Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms, superb restaurant and bar, very friendly staff - all round a first class experience (my children really enjoyed the gifts on the pillow when they came back to the room each night - nice touch). My final comment is not about the hotel but a message to future visitors to Paris - be careful at the Louvre, my daughter was pick pocketed and the police say this happens many, many times a day. That said, it was a great trip, to a great hotel in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great short break”
Reviews.Author: Tallposts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance 1st to 4th April. Location is fantastic and had a room on the fifth floor with two double beds which was great for a family with two girls. View from large window excellent. Style of hotel is very modern and the room and bathroom was modern and well sized, which is unusual for a city hotel. Overall a good quality, but a ittle expensive but overall felt we got what we paid for. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The location is fantastic, between two Metro stations it was easy to get to the major land marks in the city. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, not typical for Paris, but definitely worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: ALihn
Reviews.Content: Normally we prefer to stay authentic, but this time we made a different selection when choosing a hotel for at spring holiday in Paris. Everything was perfect, and the room had a good size since we needed an extra bed. We would have liked a bathtube, but thats not to be found in every room, though a minor issue to us. We really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rdy2CtheWorld_10
Reviews.Content: The location is just two short blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs de Elysee and very close to the metro which is perfect. The hotel is modern and and nicely decorated in an Asian fusion style. Rooms and bathroom are quite large (for Paris) with a full tub shower. We chose the deluxe room with a balcony which was slightly disappointing as it is a tiny space with one small chair and table but I enjoyed the chance to throw open the door and enjoy the sights and sounds of Paris city life. The distant vew is of La Defense and overlooks the local rooftops. The bed was too firm for my preference. The staff is warm and friendly. They were very helpful in following up with Air France to locate our lost luggage. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection of meats, fruits, juices, cereal and yogurts. It also served scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes and pancakes. It is complimentary for platinum members and 30 Euro otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Love it....love it.....”
Reviews.Author: PAinVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing!!! It's new, only 3 years old. I just love the location. When we arrived, you immediately see the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is small from the outside, almost boutique like. There is a gym which has machines and weights. You can walk to to the Champs Elysees. There are 2 very close metro stations to walk to, one is 5 minutes away and the other is about 7 min away! The staff is very courteous and helpful. Apparently my husband's Marriott status was upgraded so we got free Wi Fi. Awesome!!! Also, they gave us a great bottle of Bourdeaux in the room. We had breakfast included which was very good. They had made to order eggs/omelettes with yummy pastries. I really liked the coffee machine they had. The room we had on the 8th floor was huge (for Europe)! Loved the king size bed and big bathroom. I loved the modern look of our room. I fell in love with the mural in the bathroom. See my picture. I highly recommend this hotel!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern trendy spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: LisaMS_1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business, only one night but wish I could have stayed longer. The room was probably the largest I've had in Paris. There was the cutest little mini-Eiffel tower keychain on the bed for guests. Maybe some might find it corny, but I thought it was such a sweet little detail! The bathroom was large, fully stocked, great shower. The entrance is tucked away in between other buildings and shops so you don't really see it's a hotel, the reception although small was mondern, trendy, cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Deborah N
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned from a delightful family vacation spent in Paris, we wholeheartedly recommend The Marriott Renaissance Arc De Triomphe Hotel for accommodations. Less well known than other Parisian landmark hotels, The Renaissance offers a conveniently located, intimate--yet full-service--hotel in the heart of the city. The rooms were generously proportioned and nicely appointed, complete with wi-fi, mini bar, coffee maker, safe. and other necessities for travelers. Our rooms were quiet and very clean. The bathrooms were well-stocked with supplies, while the showers provided an ample supply of hot water. But the one attribute that made this home-away-from-home so memorable for us, was the hotel and concierge staff. From the day we made our reservations to the last good-bye, we were well cared for by the Renaissance team of, "Destination Experts". Xavier, Remi, Chloe, and Guillerme were unfailingly helpful in our quest to make the most of our time in Paris, but one concierge--Cedric--went above and beyond the call of duty, using his insight to assist us with reservations, research, and recommendations to help ensure a rich and rewarding vacation experience for our whole family. His assistance in planning our events was invaluable, and his dedication and professionalism were noteworthy. He gave us exceptional service, and we would welcome the opportunity to stay at The Renaissance Arc de Triomphe again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tripmeister
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was a brand I knew. Pros: Rooms were clean and consistent. Close to Metro. Cons: Expensive. Attempts to be hip with pulsing lobby music and colored lighting, but fails. Internet costs $30 per day and didn't work well. Two poor restaurant recommendations from the concierge - can you imagine not finding good food in Paris??

Reviews.Title: “Nice, spacious rooms. Good location, courteous staff and good value compared to other 5 star hotels.”
Reviews.Author: DoggerH
Reviews.Content: First time to Paris and we booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. So happy we did! Concierge: a couple of days prior to our arrival, we received a welcome email from the concierge. They promptly replied to all my emails about transportation to and from the airport, museum passes and restaurant recommendations. While we were there, everybody was very friendly and helpful. We also purchased the Paris museum pass and river cruise tickets from them. It was a little more expensive than buying it elsewhere but it was very convenient to just have it readily available. Additionally, they were able to reserve us a table at Guy Savoy (which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel) 2 days beforehand. Rooms: we had a mid level floor room. One of the main reasons I booked here was because the rooms were considerably larger than the other hotels I was looking at. Spacious and very clean. Nice sized bathroom. I know people complained about the half door shower but we didn't have any problems with it. We also had a small balcony which included a small table and one chair. Nice to have but our balcony also faced a bunch of other balconies so not much privacy. We actually ended up spending more time sleeping in the room and coming back to change/rest than we anticipated so it was nice to have a comfortable, larger room to relax in. They also had turndown service every night and left chocolates and various items (Eiffel tower keychain, post it notes, etc...). Like the others, we also received a complimentary bottle of champagne, chocolate dipped strawberries, a candle and book the first night. Location: right down the street from Arc de Triomphe and very close to the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro. We explored all over Paris using the Metro system. Next time we may try to stay at a different hotel just to experience another area... But would definitely come back here if we decide to stay in the same area again. Staff: everybody was very friendly... The bartenders went out of their way to find us good recommendations for what to do at night. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay over by the Arc/Champs Élysées area.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in France”
Reviews.Author: EndyBOSTON
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Location: literally down the street from the Arc and a metro stop (L'etoile), a few steps from a Starbucks and a Pharmacy. Service: One of the best I've seen, everyone is so helpful and made my and my wife's stay, very pleasant. Food: Their breakfast buffet is very good and lots of variety. If you are a Gold or Platinum member, you get it for free since there is no Executive Lounge. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant. Room: Our room was on the 6th floor, the higher the room the better I think. We faced Wagram street, very quite, not noisy at all. I would definitely come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “What else can I add about this excellent hotel?”
Reviews.Author: OilmanTexas
Reviews.Content: There have been so many positive reviews about this hotel that it is difficult to add something new. My wife and I were in Paris for a few days to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I mentioned this in an email to the hotel along with our arrival time and a request for a room on a high floor (to stay away from the Paris street noise). All of our requests were met. We checked into our room at 10:30 am and were booked on the top floor of the hotel. A few hours after checking in, they delivered a nice bottle of champagne, some chocolate covered stawberries, a small heart shaped candle, and a small book on the best places to kiss in Paris. That was over the top! I've had other hotels deliver wine or champagne or just a fruit basket, but never this much. The rest of our stay was great. Breakfast was included (Marriott Gold level) and was tasty. Usual beakfast buffet; everything was fresh and hot. The location is very convenient. We walked miles around the area. We used the Concierge to book restaurant reservations and a half day trip to Versailles. Both were excellent. The restuarant, Chez Gabrielle, was close to the hotel and was very good. I had the sea bass and my wife had the scallops. Prices were reasonable for Paris. Back to the hotel. The room was modern and comfortable. Several have commented on the shower setup, but you can limit the water leakage with an extra towel on the floor. I liked the 2 showerheads. Wireless internet was easy to access, but a little slow. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience from US Traveler - Brillant Staff & Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Flambe04
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations from the start - from the welcome email to the front desk staff to the room accommodations - everything was 5-stars. I largely stay at Hilton properties these days, but I'm glad that I changed it up this time and stayed here. Even though I no longer carry top Marriott Rewards status, they treated me and my family like we were royalty. While most European hotel rooms are smaller and only accommodate 2 people, this hotel was more than willing to work with us to include a child that was traveling with us. Brilliant staff - just brilliant. The room looked and smelled brand new with multiple channels on the flat screen tv. The bed was comfortable with new linens. The bathroom was large - even by US standards and again looked brand new. The hotel is only a couple of blocks off of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees Blvd. There are numerous local eatery's around this hotel from McDonald's & Starbucks on the low end to so many cafes and higher end restaurants that I cannot begin to name them all. We used the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was excellent with friendly staff. A couple of notes for US travelers: This property is excellent - don't be afraid to email them your questions or needs as they went out of their way to work with us. Also, if you have never been to Paris - take your food budget and double it - Paris is very expensive and about 25% higher than New York based on my experience. Excellent - just expensive. Do yourself a favor and check out this property the next time you are in Paris. They made a believer out of me and my family. Special thanks to the management and staff for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none-excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mocDublin
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at this hotel, I was contacted to advise our approx arrival time to ensure our room was ready-very impressive! As it turns out, we were hoping to arrive at the hotel before noon and it made such a difference to have access to our room immediately. The hotel itself is superb-beautiful modern lobby and our room was extremely spacious and impeccably clean. The reception staff were pleasant and friendly and greeted us warmly as we came and went. The location of this hotel has to be experienced-a two minute walk to Charles de Gaulle Etoile station from where Paris is at your fingertips. The Champs Elysses is a three minute walk-Paris on your doorstep! We were in Paris for the rugby match so didn't actually spend as much time in the hotel as we would have liked. The proof of the service in this hotel, however, materialised when we ran into difficulty. We checked out the following morning and spent the day sightseeing. That evening we were making our way out to CDG when the entire RER B line went down and was suspended for the evening. We attempted a mad dash by taxi but our flight had departed. On returning to the hotel, they quickly found us a room for the night and assisted us in rebooking flights for the following morning. On returning home, I needed proof of what had transpired in Paris for my travel insurance and e-mailed the hotel. They came back to me very quickly with all the documentation required and had even contacted the French railway service on our behalf for further verification. I cannot praise this level of service enough-that, combined with a beatiful hotel in an excellent location makes for the perfect hotel choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Twice already, can't wait for the third!”
Reviews.Author: Chatila
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have been to this lovely place twice already, and it never disappointed us. Lovely location, staff, rooms and facilities. A special mention to the concierge (all 3 of them), they are extermely patient and always come up with great recommendations. Look no further, Renaissance AdT has it all.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a spacious room for 3-4 people”
Reviews.Author: ChautauquaNY
Reviews.Content: We wanted to use our points on a room that would accommodate my husband and I, along with our 20 year old daughter, and the family rooms fit the bill. It was only one block to the Metro, line 9, or 3 blocks to Charles de Gaulle station on the Champs Ely., which connects several lines. There are a host of restaurants between either metro stop and the hotel,and many others of all types and prices within 2 blocks. Since it was 17 below while we were there, it was nice to have restaurants within easy walking distance. Yes, it is fun to return after a day out and find a little surprise from the staff (wine, chocolates, post it flags, etc.), but it was better to be able to control the temp--we liked it warm when we first returned home, then turned it down a bit. Bathroom was great--lots of room for toiletries. Took a wonderful deep bath one night to warm up after walking, as bath salts are provided. Slippers and robes were also a nice touch. Wish there had been a third chair to lounge in, as my sitting area ended up being the bed. The room was not at all cramped--spacious despite 8 suitcases!! And the wall of windows gave the room an open feel. Helpful staff, who demonstrated concern after we were victimized at the Eiffel Tower and were willing to run our tab through our credit card before we canceled it. We thought we were paying for the internet--needed to cancel our cards, but later learned it was included--this was not well advertised. This was easily the nicest hotel I've stayed in during 40 years of trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice - Quiet but Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Renaissance and it was a great experience that exceeded my expectations. The staff is very warm and welcoming. The location is a block from the Charles De Gaulle metro stop near the Arc De Triomphe so it is easy to access all the areas of Paris from the hotel. The hotel has a modern feel to it, particularly the public areas. Our room was very quiet and while there was no view to speak of, I appreciated the ability to sleep soundly every night while there. The breakfast served in the hotel's restaurant was included in our rate and was very nice with hot and cold selections from a buffet and good service. On our last night there was a red carpet event related to Paris fashion week at the hotel so the area outside was crowded with onlookers and photographers but it was managed well and didn't disrupt anything for the guests and added a bit of excitement. Finally we took a chance on eating in Makkassar- the hotel's French/Indonesian fusion restaurant one night and I was blown away by the meal we had. Excellent and unusual menu choices beautifully prepared and presented and great service there as well. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a mid-priced (for Paris) centrally located option and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Paris”
Reviews.Author: ARKBRONCO
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it's 5 Star rating. Location can not be beaten, easy access to metro with shopping and restaurants within walking distance.The rooms were very comfortable, clean and a joy to be in. The best part of the hotel is the people, never have I experienced such attention to detail by everyone on the staff. We extended our stay by 5 days as a result of the enjoyment we received from every level of the organization. I would never stay anywhere else in Paris; it is absolutely the best !

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: pierre p
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few times I have had zero complaints about a room. ZERO COMPLAINTS! The room deserves a 5 star designation. It was clean, modern, and comfortable. They even provided a complementary voltage converter/appliance adapter to… charge our cell phones and use our laptops. You're approximately 3 blocks walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Ave de Champs Ellys, you cant beat the location. Beware internet access is expensive ($8 per hour)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week. I was trying to use Marriott points for our trip, and I was worried about what we would find. The Renaissance Arc de Triomphe was a gem. It was a beautiful, modern hotel. The service was impeccable. My girlfriend's luggage was lost enroute, and the staff kept us informed regularly about its status. Our room was very large for Paris and tastefully decorated. But we didn't travel to Paris to stay in a hotel. We were out walking every day, and the hotel is perfectly located just a few meters away from the Arc de Triomphe which is the beginning of the Champs-Elysées Avenue. That means that you are steps away from all the shops, restaurants, and people, and the hotel is off the main drag on Avenue Wagram, which is quiet and quaint--it's a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, With a Few Needed Tweaks”
Reviews.Author: pbycz
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. We found the location to be ideal...close to 2 metro stops, shopping, a wide variety of restaurants (even family friendly McDonalds, Quick and Starbucks) and tourist sites. We pulled right up to the front door and the staff unpacked and wisked away our car in no time! The staff at the front desk and concierge were super-helpful, knowledgeable, and patient with our French. If needed, most of the staff speaks English. Our room was clean and bright, but we did not have a bathtub. It would have been great to have been made aware of that fact. I found the bathroom very nice, but not as functional as it could be. There was only a shower and the glass door was only a 1/2 door. You never felt quite warm when showering and the the water would spill out onto the bathroom floor. Traveling with a child...only doubled that mess! We did not have enough towels in the bathroom when we arrived even though they place an extra roll away bed, but it was quickly corrected when called. On the last day we arrived back at 445 pm from all-day site seeing and our room was not cleaned. We heard a knock on the door and before we could answer the cleaning staff was coming into our room. Jeepers...it is a bit late for that! We just took clean towels and skipped the cleaning. (hmm...maybe we are obsessed with towels:) The breakfast was average, but I really loved the porridge and the fresh mango. Overall, we had a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Triumphant in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Texastravveler
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arc de Triomphe is located on the Avenue Wagram close to L'Etoile and its metro/RER stop. The location itself is convenient since it is in the center of the rive droite, but the reasons for staying there only begin with the location. The exterior of the hotel is modern and the interior even more so. The decorative lights extend all through the hotel with elevators that are a different color every time you step into them. The staff is helpful, thoughtful and truly eager to please--so forget your stereotypes of French service. Our room was large (although I would not have called it a junior suite as they did) and tastefully decorated. It overlooked the Avenue Wagram, but nevertheless, was quite, both in the daytime and at night. The large windows (floor to ceiling) were curtained in such a way that you could see everything when you wanted and close out everything when you did not. Not the largest bathroom--but certainly adequate. There is a large fitness room. They also provide towels and bottle water in the lobby for runners. I don't remember a pool. The service for the room was excellent with frequent clean-ups. The turndown service at night featured a variety of interesting sweet tidbits from various locales in France. My husband especially adored the box of chocolates that looked like small pebbles (the box said that this was a specialty of Provence). The breakfast in the restaurant was only so-so, and I would suggest that you frequent another local restaurant if breakfast is not included and you are expected to pay the full 28 euro price. (There is a Starbuck's and a McDonald's within a short walk as well as other typical French sidewalk cafes.) The dinner we had there was delightful, if a little pricey. The restaurant features a combination of Indonesian and French foods. My husband was very pleased with his plat which included skewers of swordfish, shrimp and chicken on a bed of noodles. Our bill, without wine, was 75 euros and that was for 1 appetizer, 2 main courses and 1 dessert. There are certainly better (and lots that are worse) restaurants in Paris at this price. But, we were certainly not unhappy with this meal which we ate the first night we arrived in France. It reminded us again of why we love France and Paris. In all, I thought that this hotel as every right to share in the name Arc de Triomphe. It has risen to the top of our favorite hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GVKelly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night to celebrate his birthday this past weekend. The hotel is in a great location, just steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaulle metro stop. The hotel was very helpful even before we arrived. I had several emails back and forth with the hotel concierge and they assisted me in confirming a dinner reservation that I had previously made. I had ordered a bottle of wine to be delivered to our room upon arrival and was a little upset when it didn't appear right away. However, it did arrive after about and hour and a half along with some sweets. When the girl brought it to our room she said it was a "gift from the hotel" which I thought was strange since I had pre-ordered it myself. But, when we checked out it wasn't on the bill and when I asked I was told that it had been a gift from the hotel after all. I'm not sure where the mix-up came in, but either way it was a good bottle of wine and I was even happier when it ended up being a "gift". We didn't use the hotel restaurant at all but decided instead to try breakfast at a Cafe Lateral around the corner from the hotel (on Rue Mac-Mahon). Overall the staff of the hotel were very helpful (getting us taxi's, helping us into our room when our key stopped working, etc). We are planning another trip to Paris in the early summer and are planning to stay here again during that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: I see I'm not alone in having an extraordinary experience at this hotel this week. I was able to use points and a cash upgrade for this past weekend. (Apparently that isn't the norm for last minute reservations?). My broken French made for some entertaining interaction with the incredibly attentive and accomodating staff. The "Prestige" room had floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Ave de Wagram on the front side of the hotel. Noise was NOT an issue. Everything was clean and colorful and really conducive to a nice stay. The Navigator had several options for tours, restaurants and anything we needed. There are numerous Brasseries, Bars, Restaurant and Cafes within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. We did not try the hotel restaurant but we were told it is outstanding by other guests. The staff was beyond attentive, beyond accomodating and beyond just plain nice. They were fun too - and that made the overnight even more worthwhile. I am saving "quarters" for the next Paris visit to spend the cash and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tophatafc
Reviews.Content: Our first day in Paris and the Hotel was able to get us a room a few hours earlier than normal check-in times. The room as very clean with modern decor. The front-desk was very accomodating. Their breakfast buffet was out of this world. Very good food. This place is worh every penny from location to service and food.

Reviews.Title: “100% recommend”
Reviews.Author: ben r
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my girlfriend over Valentine's Day in February 2012. I was incredibly impressed with the hotel and would happily recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Paris. The location is excellent, with no views of the Arc de Triomphe but it's literally a 60 second walk away. The Charles de Gaulle Etoile RER metro stop is also a minute away, which is convenient for cheap travel. The hotel room was modern and spacious. The bathroom was especially large, complete with a really great shower. The lobby, reception area, corridors and lifts were all modern and very tidy. The hotel staff were great and only to happy to facilitate requests. If anything the phone calls from reception checking we had received the extra hangers, extra towels and kettle were a little excessive, but it was good to know they were checking we had received good service. In short, the hotel was excellent and as a result I would highly recommend it. 5*

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: AlexandIan226
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a birthday present for my husband. We spent 3 nights at this hotel & found it to be an excellent hotel. Every member of staff was friendly and helpful. My husband emailed the hotel prior to our arrival asking if they could book some restaurants for us in advance, this was not a problem at all. In fact, on our arrival at the hotel we asked the navigator if she could advise which mode of transport would be quickest to our restaurant for the evening & she immediately remembered our email and greeted us by name. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the front of house staff, & there were always lots of sweets & chocolates at the desks! Our room was on level 5, and overlooked a quiet courtyard. It was spotlessly clean with plenty of toiletries & the bed was really comfy - just what you needed after a full day of sightseeing. The Metro was a few minutes walk from the hotel entrance. There were some lovely restaurants in the side streets near to the hotel & 2 supermarkets a few minutes walk away too. All in all, this is a trendy & clean hotel with efficient & helpful staff. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Paris with the family”
Reviews.Author: Hayley S
Reviews.Content: We planned a return visit to Paris after 23 years - the last time my now husband proposed, this time we took our two boys with us. We had one night of luxury in this hotel and it was most probably the most luxurious and indulgent night the four of us have experienced! From the moment we arrived I felt like royalty and after a full day "walking" Paris it was very much needed! The added surprise of a chilled bottle of champagne, chocolates and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us upon arrival in the room was truly superb, all with the compliments of the hotel - I can only assume they took note of my husband's comment about it being our first trip back to Paris in 23 years. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: marceloch
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, very good service and price for a 5 stars hotel in paris ... modern and very well cared ... will return and recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Excellent winter vacation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelNut_713
Reviews.Content: My friend used her points to book each of us a room for 5 nights at this magnificent hotel, stone throw away from Arc de Triomphe at the beginning of Dec 2011. It was my 2nd trip to Paris in the year, but this was the first time I stayed in this part of city. My room was very comfortable, spacious, and had serene view to the courtyard. I left the window to the patio open when sleeping getting the cool air in and listening to the almost quiet traffic Paris. It was the complete opposite from the regular hotel that I visit every year in Paris. The staff was excellent, very helpful, knowledgeable and professional. Though the breakfast buffet was filling, it was nothing special. The metro is steps away from the hotel entrance. A very convenient location. The bistros 2 doors away have wonderful fix menus at very reasonable prices. Excellent seafood restaurant only steps away towards the flower market at the corner street. It's pricey but well worth the money. In summary, I'd go back to stay there again in the future hopefully. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with customer service! Preferred the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: When we were choosing which Marriott to stay in Paris, we had a hard time choosing between this one and the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe, so we stayed at both. In this review I will compare the two because I’m sure many travelers are faced with the same decision. Check-in: We tried to get early check-in to both the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel (Marriott) and the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe (Renaissance). In both cases, we had to wait for our room because they were getting special rooms available for us (overlooking the Champs Elysees at the Marriott, and a room with a curved window at the Renaissance). No problem, we left our luggage and explored Paris. When we returned (in both cases around 6:00), we were not in the premium rooms promised at either hotel! The rooms were nice; they just faced the courtyard instead. At the Marriott, our luggage was in the room, along with a welcome gift (1/2 bottle of wine, bottle of water and desserts) and our Marriott Rewards gift (1/2 bottle of wine and a fabulous cheese platter). At the Renaissance, we had a welcome gift (bottle of wine and some fishy-tasting crackers) but had to wait for our luggage and rewards gift. Rooms: Both rooms were nice, a little on the small side and comparable with amenities. The Marriott was elegant, with a nice garden tub and separate shower. The furnishings were elegant, the bed was not as comfortable -- it felt like there was quilt serving as a pillow-top on top of the mattress. The Renaissance was understated luxury -- more trendy furniture but a very comfortable bed. The bathroom did not have a tub, but had a nice rain shower head. The Renaissance was cleaner. Service: I didn’t think there was any comparison in service. At the Marriott, you would never touch a door – the bellmen/doormen were extremely attentive and helpful. The front desk and concierge were also great – and it was nice to have our luggage taken to our room without request. My husband is a platinum Marriott member, and after reading the reviews of the Renaissance, we were very disappointed with our service. The front desk was great, but that was the extent. We would come home at night, and rather than opening the door, the bellman just stared at us (I thought he was a security guard trying to act hard). It took over two hours to get a bottle of wine that we were promised would be delivered in five minutes. Unless we greeted the reception area personnel first, we weren’t acknowledged. Not typical for a Marriott, being French isn’t a good excuse. Location: Marriott is in a better location. There were several homeless people sleeping on the grates near the Renaissance. Restaurant: Breakfast was much better at the Marriott, as was the service. The Marriott was relaxing and bright and cheerful. The Renaissance was more suited for the evening, and the morning servers acted like they had a late evening out. If I went back to Paris, I would choose the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel over the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe. Even though the Renaissance bed was more comfortable and I enjoyed the trendier atmosphere, service is #1 and the Renaissance just wasn’t there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service levels”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: From the welcome to the farewell, service standards at this modern hotel are as close to faultless as one will probably find in the real world. Nothing too much trouble, everything undertaken with charm and easy grace. Rooms are spacious and spotless, beds comfortable, food is plentiful and good. Beautiful gifts were waiting for us in our room. This is a hotel other hoteliers should perhaps visit to see how it is done. The location is 200m from the Arc, leaving perhaps a fairly relaxed 20 minute walk beyond that to the Tour d'Eiffel and Seine to the South. The Metro within yards of the the hotel is a direct line to the Louvre and Bastille and is easy to use and understand even for non French speakers. This is not a cheap option, this is a high quality option,and this hotel delivers very high quality indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Tquinta
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 6 night stay at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. We stayed in a Family room that had 2 Queen Beds. Our room was very nice, with modern decor, spacious and well equiped. Beds are great!!. Service was always very good, staff are friendly and attentive. Location is GREAT for tourists, the area is full of restaurants of all types and you're just a few blocks from Champs Elysees for great shopping. Also the Metro is just 2 blocks away. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I've experienced in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: chervin18
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip from Europe last night. This time I went to Florence, Rome, and Paris. I couldn't wait to write this review for this property because I was impressed with the customer service that my family and I received. Check-In: We stayed at this property for 3 nights. I requested an early check-in because our flight from Rome was early. They were able to accommodate my request with no problem. In fact, I received an email prior to my arrival confirming my reservation and asking if I had any special request which I did. I requested a feather free room. During the check-in process, the lady told me that they made sure the room was feather free. It was a very smooth process. Complimentary Gifts: I'm a Platinum Elite Marriott Rewards member. One of the benefits I selected is a half bottle of wine and chocolate. As soon as we got inside the room and our bags delivered, the phone rang asking if they can go ahead and deliver the welcome gift. I said sure and literally less than a minute later, someone was already knocking at the door. To my suprise, she had 2 regular bottles (NOT half bottles) of Bordeaux, 4 mugs, and lots of chocolate. I am a wine lover so I couldn't stop smiling. As if that was not enough, the next evening, someone knocked at the door again and when I opened, a very nice young lady asked if they could offer me a complimentary pre-chilled bottle of champagne! I thought they made a mistake because I already received my welcome gift but she assured me that she has the right room. Wow! Breakfast: Their breakfast is very good. I received 4 complimentary breakfast buffet (worth 28 euros each) as one of my elite status benefits. There's oatmeal, eggs, sausage, mushroom, smoked salmon, halibut, mackerel, pancakes, fresh fruits, juice, capuccino. My kids liked the sample smoothie at the reception so we ordered a bigger portion as well as hot chocolate from the staff. They were very attentive and delivered right away. That's not the best part though. The next two mornings, I was greeted by my name (I'm wondering how they remembered me because there are quite a bit of people staying there) and the staff remembered that my kids liked the strawberry banana smoothie and chocolate so they just delivered it to us without even asking for it. How is that for personal service? I've been to many hotels all over the world but that level of personal service is not common. (Well, another hotel that had the similar service was the Renaissance in Makati, Philippines.) Concierge: As stated, I only stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Our time there was limited. We asked the concierge for some directions for the Metro and other point of interests. He went above and beyond of what we asked him. He basically arranged our itinerary for us. He told us where to go first to minimize the number of metro transfers that we had to do, where to shop, what to see, etc. It was the next best thing to having a personal tour guide. Our day was extremely efficient and we accomplished a lot because of his help. There were other times we asked for the concierge's help. Valet - On our last day there, my wife wanted to go to a pharmacy to buy a cosmetic product. She approached one of the valet attendant and asked what time the pharmacy opens (we didn't realize there were a couple in the area). My wife was extremely surprised and impressed when the attendant said "I'll go check for you madame". Then, he ran to the pharmacy to check. Again, wow! That was totally unexpected. I can go on and on but the bottom line is that this hotel is great! If you're in Paris, stay at this hotel! You won't be disappointed I used to stay at another high end Marriott in Paris (not too far away from this location) but from now on, I will be staying at this property whenever I'm in Paris. To the staff - THANK YOU for an amazing experience! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Paris without shabby chic just the chic”
Reviews.Author: J_and_R_AKL
Reviews.Content: Loved this place staff happy to serve in French and English. Room very modern and the location is great feels a bit neibourhood but also right in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Emilyaq
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, great location, in the heart of the action. The main reason for my review is to praise the concierge team, amazing! Could not do enough, wonderful! Drinks in the hotel bar are ridiculously price but as expected in a five star. Balcony rooms are available, with ashtrays should you wish to smoke! Lovely clean rooms, great rain showers, English toiletries in the bathroom! Would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: hurstyshollies
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in oct 2011 for a concert.Location was central to everything hence name of hotel.We didnt get to eat at the hotel restuarant as it was fully booked,however hotel recomendations to neighbouring resturants were not good...ie, 4 dissapointing steak with fries £200. Hotel was modern,clean with large comfy beds,however Paris is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nealer96
Reviews.Content: While it is a little expensive, the location and extremely helpful staff makes up for it. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone... If I return to Paris, the Renaissance will be my first call.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Paris modern, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad0921
Reviews.Content: Very modern, well appointed but not ostentatious. The room was not overly large but very comfortable - the king bed was luxurious and quiet - our room faced away from Rue du Wagram into an inner courtyard. This means that there wasn't much of a view of the city. The lack of view was more than compensated for by the exceptional location. The hotel was an easy 5 minute walk to the Arc du Triomphe and the Champs Élysées. My wife and I are both runners - this hotel allowed to walk 20-30 minutes down Avenue Kleber to the Trocadero to get postcard shots of the Eiffel Tower at night, take in th local street traffic, enjoy local cafes. We especially enjoyed a run to the Arc, down the Champs Élysées to the Grand Palace and Palais Petite, and along the Seine - a fantastic scenic run! The hotel restaurant Mafessar was reasonable with good food - My wife had duck and I had fish, both of which were delectable. Lastly, the concierge service was exceptional, as good as any hotel we've visited. Cedric became "our" concierge - he was a wealth of knowledge and provided recommendations when asked, these were always on the money and made our stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: Travelchica23
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really fabulous - we used points to stay 4 nights for free and they upgraded us to a junior suite for 2 nights, and the other 2 night were in a premium room (the 4 nights were not consecutive). The rooms are extremely clean & well decorated. The junior suite was a great large size, and the premium room was smaller but still a good size, nothing at all like the tiny closet of a room we had at another Paris hotel we stayed at during this trip... The beds were comfortable... the junior suite got very dark at night which was fab... the premium room on the 5th floor did not get as dark, as the hotels has these lights that are on all night and they really illuminate the room - I found that pretty annoying. The bathrooms are really great & in working order... We had an issue with our heat blowing cold air, so they sent someone up.... the next night we had the same issue, and they said they would send someone up, but they never did, so points are docked for that.... also our last night they were supposed to leave our bill under the door so we could do an express check out, but they also forgot that.... other than that the staff was very nice & willing to help us find restaurants and directions etc. The location is okay in my opinion... not the best. It is true it is near the metro so that is good but I'd prefer to be within walking distance of more things. We stayed at another hotel for part of the trip, it had a better location but overall the Renaissance was just a much better hotel and nicer place to come back to after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rabfel
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris more than a couple of times. I always end up staying in OK hotels but there is always something not so good about them like the size of the room or the "Paris" attitude of the staff. This Hotel was excellent, the rooms are very nice, super clean, super comfortable and VERY NICELY decorated. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, they went out of their way in helping us get places and the neighborhood is a great neighborhood. Just a couple of blocks from The Arc du Triomphe. I can't stress enough how nice the hotel is and how comfortable it is. Nothing to complain about when it comes to ambiance and cleanliness! I also did not find this hotel particularly expensive, they gave us an AAA rate which took 20% of the room rate and it made it quite accessible compared to other Paris Hotels. I was here with my wife and we both loved it. BTW the workout room was excellent with very nice equipment and very modern, lots of towels and free drinks. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding--- just book it!”
Reviews.Author: Sheherazade70
Reviews.Content: Located just steps from le Arc de Triomphe and many great cafes and shops, the hotel is situated in a wonderful part of Paris---close enough to all the action but quiet enough at night to relax free of noisy city streets. The hotel is spotlessly clean with a modern flair. I'm usually a fan of the older, "grand" hotels of Paris but this property blew them all away in terms of service. The rooms are extraordinarily spacious by European standards with every imaginable ammenity needed and most notably the most luxurious linens I've ever slept on. Managment welcomed me with a complimentary full bottle of wine and other thoughtful gifts. The restaurant was undergoing renovations during my stay but this did not dampen the quality of service or the lovely breakfast that was served each morning. Like all hotel restaurants, breakfast is pricey so be sure to get a good deal with a room that includes it. The mark of a truly great hotel is how they handle maintenance and renovation issues--it was of absolutely no inconvenience to its guests. The team was remarkable-- front desk, Cedric the Concierge, Gerilas in the business center, and the entire housekeeping staff. Each night the turndown service was lovely with a special little gift left along with Provencal chocolates and weather report. Not a detail was missed at this hotel and it truly made my stay in Paris perfect. Other hotels should really take note of how well run this property is.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: addtraveler10101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance in November. My husband and I heard hotel rooms in Paris are teeny tiny. Don't know if that's true. This was our first trip to Paris. It's ceratinly not true at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well appointed. The decor is contemporary with a Parisian flair. I think all the rooms have a balcony eiher streetside or facing the courtyard. The location is perfect. You will be a couple blocks form the Arc. Which you can seee from the front of the hotel. Equally close to the Champs, and even closer to the Metro. There are unlimited numbers of restaurants within walking distance. Something for everyone and every budget. They have a restaurant at the hotel. In the morning a wonderful brekfast buffet is served. For lunch and dinner it is sort of steakhouse/Indian. We only ate breakfast there. The food was good, something for everyone. The hotel staff is attentive and fun.They all speak some level of English. As my husband and I fumbled with our bad French, they were patient and helped us along. Can't say enough about the hotel and staff. You will be evry happy with your stay. Never ever skip the nougat candies they have at the desk. You'll be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: travellotus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of August so the city was still on the quiet side. The location is good for sightseeing and was quiet while we were there. The hotel is beautifully designed and the rooms are spacious for European standards. The breakfast could use some improvements and was generally overpriced. The staff was very friendly, except for one concierge. He was actually quite rude. The only other issue we had was waiting for the elevator...10 minutes or more at peak hours and trying to squeeze in with the bellboy and all the luggage. Apparently, they didn't put that into their design consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, Comfy, and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GringoGator
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a historic hotel with Parisian architecture then this is not your place. If you want a huge room, contemporary design, great location, and wonderful service then this place will leave you ultra-satisfied! Everyone told me the room in Paris are tiny - not here. You can expect a room size similar to any Renaissance in the States. The rooms are tastefully decorated with a colorful, contemporary design. We went during the Christmas holidays and the lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays. Service was exceptional! Everyone speaks English but I encourage you to try out your French speaking skills as the staff will gladly help you improve your language skills. There is not a concierge room there but if you are an elite Rewards member a full breakfast is included (includes buffet, menu, and specialty coffee drinks). The location? Perfect! You can walk to the Champs Elysees in 5 minutes. Excellent restaurants close by. A major Metro station is 3 blocks away. J'adore le Rensaissance and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and well designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: salmiero
Reviews.Content: Been ther during Christmas and was pleased with hotel new design and look. Room are big as for EU standards, breakfast is good too. But there are a lot of choice to eat Mcdonalds and French Burger just down the street. Staff is friendly and always try to help as soon as possible, overall didn't find any cons in this hotel, metro is just around block and supermarket is over the corner. So if you want to buy something not available at food stores - you are welcome. Anyway - location is great. Also the BED is so soft and warm - its a dream, climate system is silent and work as Swiss clocks. Thank you Renaissance. p.s. One con is exist- internet - is way overpriced and so slooooow. Unusual in this price range in Paris not to give free wifi to you guest. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RSM_6300
Reviews.Content: 1. modern clean, comfortable rooms and extremely spacious by Paris standards. Exactly the size and comfort you would get from a business class hotel in the US. Not over-the-top luxury, but very very comfortable. The hotel is relatively new, so none of the old, musty thing. 2. incredibly kind and friendly staff. I was actually shocked at how nice they were, given my past experiences in Paris. Concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful. Here is the thing - if you can afford really over the top - Four Seasons, or Ritz, it not that type of hotel. But for the next level down ( and this hotel is NOT inexpensive), older hotels in older cities tend to be less that perfectly kept up. Old hotels are hard to keep pristine. This is a wonderful alternative. You may miss out on the grand old look, but you also miss out on all the disadvantages that an older building can have. 3. Location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Judy W
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service is absolutely fabulous. This is our first time to Paris and we stayed 6 nights at the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe. The concierge/navigator services available was outstanding. They assisted us to confirm all of our tours, restaurant reservations and guided us how to take their subway system. All in all this hotel's service is phenomenal. Their fitness faciity was wonderful. Of the 6 nights of my stay I used the fitness center 4-5 times. It allowed me to stay consistent with my fitness routine while I was vacationing which is important. Their business center was also very helpful in guiding us where to go to book advance tickets to avoid busy line-ups. The best part of the rooms is the comfortable beds and pillow. This is the most comfortable hotel bed that I"ve ever stayed in so far. The rooms are soundproof so you don't hear people walking pass the hallway or closing the doors. That is very important to me as I"m a light sleeper. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a modern stay and a central location. Best Marriot hotel that I have stayed in so far.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pegasustr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 11 for 5 nights. The hotel is relatively small, if I am not mistaken around 50-60 rooms and does not have gym, pool or executive lounge. However, it offers Marriott France typical breakfast that is ok. The building is tastefully decorated and new/modern look, I stayed in a courtyard room that has nice view (La Defense) quite silent additionally it has a balcony that is quite exceptional. The room size could be considered as big for Paris standards and decoration is quite cute in the room / bathroom. Again; it is silent, safe phenomenal location almost next to the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysees. There are Starbucks, Quick, Mc Donalds, Metro, Bus stop etc. just few steps away. Due my gold status at Marriott Rewards, I received free breakfast, room upgrade is also offered (daily 140€ to junior suite). I also got daily some presents (block notes, a book on 100 places to kiss in Paris, some chocolates, a decent bottle of champagne). Our stay was gorgeous, I am well-travelled (gold to Hilton/Marriot, Platinum Priority Club) and the property and service we received at this hotel is clearly one of the best in Europe. I stayed at Paris Marriott afterwards the difference is enormous.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FennyG77
Reviews.Content: Best part is we were offered to be upgraded to Arc de Triomphe suite with reasonable price and it is indeed the best room there with all the view that comes with name of the suite. Very modern hotel and we like the Makassar concept as we are Indonesian. Location wise, it is close-by everywhere and it is convenient to walk around all the way to Eiffel. There is one good French restaurant next door, they have lots of other restaurants along the street which is another plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Concierge Service by CHLOE”
Reviews.Author: Ehartanto
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel for 8 nights after a long survey and comparing with other hotel on the similar range. The location is superb, short walk to metro, arc de triomphe and Champ Elysee. McDonald and Zenzan Japanese Resto (chicken and salmon teriyaki are surprisingly beautiful) are located in between hotel and metro make life much easier. The hotel room is spacious for Paris hotel size with balcony. Overall we have pleasant stay during our holiday in Paris.. The concierge is very helpful, attentive to your need and meet your requirement precisely - I'm talking particularly about CHLOE. Her assistance and services are outstanding. If you need to plan your trip or ask for guidance. Ask for Chloe. Renaissance must be lucky to have her as part of the team.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paris, good location”
Reviews.Author: familylady99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and this is a good hotel. Beds are comfortable and the room is well appointed. We are rewards member and received free buffet breakfast every day. This was around a $170 value for 4 people and it is an excellent buffet. The hotel was quiet and you really couldn't hear any noise. The concierge was very helpful for restaurants and tickets, etc. The bar and restaurant prices are quite high, but typical for Paris. However, this is a very nice hotel and only a couple of blocks from the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dsareen
Reviews.Content: An architecturally significant building with its curved glass floor to ceiling windows. It stands out from the otherwise classical Parisian streetscape. Walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe. The interiors are contemporary, minimalist touch, and most certainly one of the more impressive Renaissance hotels I have stayed. Nice breakfast buffet. Restaurant overlooks an interior courtyard with "green" walls on the adjacent brick walls. Have stayed here twice, and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; excellent impression”
Reviews.Author: keld0rama
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here while in Paris at the beginning of a 10-day trip over Thanksgiving. We had 2 rooms as my elderly mother was with us. Very accommodating front desk staff; we were early after an overnight flight from the US, but our rooms were ready and we were allowed to check in. Staff speaks fluent English, though I did try my high school French. The executive-level rooms are very spacious; large bathrooms with very modern fixtures. Turn-down service each evening provided a nice little surprise in the way of chocolates. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. Metro and RER station at the hub; Starbucks about a block south of the hotel on the same side of the street; McDonalds (if you have kids) about a block beyond that. There are numerous restaurants and cafes on Avenue de Wagram, both across the street from and on either side of the hotel. If we ever returned to Paris, I would stay here again. I will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BFG1999
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel is a few steps away from the Arc de Triomphe, halfway between two metro stations this is an ideal location to visit all the sights of Paris, although my feet hurt now! Helpful and attentive staff, surrounded by places to eat including the makassat in the hotel, with shops all around. For UK visitors beware, Paris is much more expensive than it was due to the drastic drop in exchange rates over the last few years, take advantage of the many fixed-price "meal deals" in the nearby eateries and you will be pleasantly surprised though. Take advantage of the 'Book of Ten' deal on the T+ tickets - the cheapest and best way yo get around quickly.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: lisek187129
Reviews.Content: I originally found this hotel from the marriott.com website when I was looking to use hotel points and was looking for a nice hotel in a safe area. This hotel exceeded expectations. Has all the modern luxuries one would expect with great service and a phenominal location. You are feet away from two metro stops and can easily walk to starbucks, Champs elysees, the Arc de Triomphe and many other sites. Hotel staff was wonderful, gave great dinner recommendations, and breakfast was delicious. I have stayed three times in the last year or so, and can't imagine a better find. I have been in March 2010, August 2011 and now December 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: global5000pilot
Reviews.Content: Loved the area around the hotel- walking distance to the Champs and the Arc de Triomphe, lots of great shopping, cafes, pubs. Rooms are very modern and comfortable. Internet worked well. Lobby bar/restaurant was excellent. Rates are very high, but you're paying for style, comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Good location”
Reviews.Author: chitxn070
Reviews.Content: Property is only a few years old and built from scratch. Friendly staff, good breakfast if included in your rate, spacious rooms with modern feel. If arriving at CDG, consider the Air France Bus as I drops you off about four blocks from the property for 15EUR. One bus and no hassle with the RER. Discounts were offered for booking online in advance. I used points for my stay and feel the return was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: Workaholic055
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great location for visiting all the usual landmarks of Paris. Use the metro, brilliant service which gets you everywhere you want to go. We bought a three day ticket which was extremely good value. Service at the hotel and it's staff exceptionally good the best hotel we have stayed in for a long time. Our visit was a Birthday treat and the hotel gave my partner a bottle of champagne which was a very nice thought. Staff very helpful especially the information desk at reception. Nothing was too much trouble. Hotel was a five star experience in every way. Thank you for making our visit so special.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, with a good style, but less than you would expect from Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: KatieG75
Reviews.Content: Not bad for location, but if you really want to go for something close to EVERYTHING, go for hotels near Louvre. This one is at the edge, so not walking distance to main spots. You do, however, have a metro nearby, and loads of shops. Inside, hotel is very modern. Very cosy. Very pleasant service. Unfortunately, two very slow lifts, which are used by staff - not a big deal, but spoils the impression. And, at the restaurant, nice food, but a BIG deal out of anything you ask for. As if, you ask for something for free. Well, it seams to be a general attitude in Paris, so why would this hotel be different? :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at a Hip Property”
Reviews.Author: UnworldlyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My two fellow travelers and I spent four nights at the Renaissance and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Prior to our arrival, the hotel proactively contacted us to ask for our arrival time and any special requests. We did end up arriving before check-in and were set up with juice, coffee, and assorted pastries while we waited for our room. This was a very nice gesture after a long overnight flight. Our room was on the third floor and featured soundproofed walls, two double beds, and 377 square feet. Even with three people in the room, we never felt cramped. The bathroom was also spacious, with a deep tub and modern fixtures. Our only complaint about the room was that the shower was slow to drain, a problem that a 5-star property shouldn't have. The hotel left small gifts in the room each day: chocolates, little notebooks, a bottle of wine. We very much appreciated the extra touch. We didn't try the hotel's restaurant, but we did consult the concierge for restaurant recommendations in the area. All staff members, from the bartenders to the porters to the front desk staff, were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is located in a sophisticated neighborhood on the Right Bank, in close proximity to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, and Charles de Gaulle - Etoile Metro stop. While the immediate area is rather commercial and less charming than, say, the winding cobblestone streets of the Latin Quarter, extensive public transportation makes it easy to get anywhere in the city. If you are looking for a clean and modern facility where your comfort will be guaranteed, the Renaissance is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edsatty
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while in Paris last week. I had started the week at the Intercontinental Le Grand, and this was a totally different experience. It really depends on what type of hotel you enjoy in Europe - one that is super modern, glass, steel, top notch electronics or one that is more "traditional" old school French/French Provincial. The Renaissance is the former. Internet worked, flat screen tv, shower was a "rain shower" head (which after a barely working horrible shower at the Intercontinental, was a God send), Iphone/computer chargers/plugs. Was approximatelyy 3 blocks from the Arc de Triumph metro station, and just off the Champs Elysee. Stayed here with Marriott points, and free breakfast since we are Platinum members, so cannot comment on price versus value for room or food. Only ate breakfast there, and the buffet was excellent, with "American" coffee available. The only negative I have to say is about the knowledge of the front desk personnel. I had my Iphone stolen after being surrounded by a group of teenagers/thieves near the Louvre and they had very little interest/knowledge in helping me contact or visit the police to file a police report (which I needed to file an insurance claim). The regular front desk people claimed they had no idea what to do/who to contact, and the concierge gave me wrong information as to what time the police station opened in the morning (she told me 8 am when it was 9 am) when I was already on a very tight time line to get to the airport for a departing flight. They did help me call AT&T to cancel my phone/data service, after I gave them to website info.

Reviews.Title: “Good with children”
Reviews.Author: ompom
Reviews.Content: We took our 10, 7 and 4 yr old. Stayed in double queen room with a rollaway bed, to sleep 5. Not many hotels do this. Had breakfast at Starbucks up the road as 28 Euro per person, is a bit steep. I would agree with previous reviews about location and comfort. Cost 45 euros for 5 to travel from CDG to Arc de Triomphe metro via train, cost 50 Euro for taxi back to CDG! Would definitely use again, and children loved it

Reviews.Title: “New hotel,modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: DeluxeTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed last summer. I chose this hotel because it was new and had two queen beds in one hotel room, which is hard to find in most european hotels. Check in was speedy and we did get a room facing the street which I requested. The room was clean and modern. We were on the second floor and could hear some traffic noise. The location was fairly good, but very touristy being off the Champs Elysee. We did have to wait for our room to be cleaned until late in the day. If we came back from sightseeing and wanted to relax, I would just have the maid take the trash out and give us new towels. Concierage was very helpful giving us information and getting us a taxi etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Second stay? Almost as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: kermitdude
Reviews.Content: This was the second year in a row I've stayed at this property over Thanksgiving...both stays on points with Platinum Marriot members. In general, the hotel is in a phenomenal location - 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe; in between 2 different Metro lines and several blocks over from the Champs. (For those flying in to CDG, the Air France bus (Les Cars Air France), stops 2 - 3 blocks up and one street over - with limited luggage it would be a very manageabe walk...having said that - we took cabs from and to the airport - early saturday am in and around 3:00 on friday returning and both fares - with and without traffic - were right around 40 euros...I believe the bus is 19 each way...there were two of us so for the extra euro? I like the cab myself) The rooms are very contemporary and very clean - they do show a bit of wear since last year but nothing overt (scuff marks here and there, a bit of peeling paint on the ceiling in the bathroom). The breakfast buffet (included with Marriott status) has not changed at all and that is fine - eggs, bacon, sausage, several types of coffee, fruits and breads - free? It's a great deal...for 28 euros? eh... Why do I say this was almost as good as the last stay? We got off to a little bit of a rocky start - while the hotel staff was very accomodating in checking us in to our room at 10.30 am (vs. 3.00 pm ck in) - it took 3 phone calls and personal trip downstairs to get our luggage delivered over an hour later...things do happen and we were perhaps a wee bit grumpy from the traveling to get there...so I consider it a wash but I was a little disappointed with that... Having said that - I have absolutely no other complaints about our stay there (and if you read the review on my Bellagion stay in Vegas a couple of weeks ago - I will say it!) The staff is wonderful and accomodating - the concierge's are truly helpful. If you reference my review from last year you will see my glowing reference to the Bosch espresso machine in the room - sadly - unbeknownst to me that was an upgraded room; while the room we were in had a kettle with instant coffees provided, it was not the Bosch and I missed it! I highly recommend a stay at the Renaissance - you cannot beat the location, cleanliness and friendliness of the staff! I would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: Hotel location, service, room quality/location were perfect. It's a short walk to the metro, Arc de Triomphe and the neighborhood is wonderful. There are a number of very nice restaurants in the area as well. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just a few steps from the Arc De Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: thnarf
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Paris I did a video trip report of my stay at the Paris Renaissance Arc De Triomphe Hotel on youtube here: http://youtu.be/sEqpGQ6vlbg Below is the written trip report which goes in to even greater detail. The hotel is located convienently just about 3 blocks from the Arc De Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. A taxi to the hotel from CDG airport is about 45 Euro (not during rush hour). Or a cheap and also convienent alternative is to take the Air France bus, direct from the Airport to the Arc De Triomphe for about 13 euro, and then walk three blocks. Note, when you take the Air France bus, take the bus from the airport that stops at the “Etoille.” Charles De Gualle Etoille is the name of the metro stop at the Arc De Triomphe, so those names are often used interchangeably for the location. Also the metro here is very convienent, because metro Line 1 stops at the Etoille, which can be used to get the Louvre, and many of the other touristy sites in Paris. And for those of you that can’t live without McDonalds and/or Starbucks, both are within 2 blocks of the hotel as well. The hotel itself is has a modern architecture and style with a bit of French / Asian fusion flair. It’s 8 stories tall, and the street side has a set of curvy/wavy windows that glow at night. The lobby is surrounded in dark wood tones, with red and yellow lighting that are meant to simulate candles. The lobby itself is small as most Paris hotels are, but is typically very well staffed. There were often not one, but two doormen that would open the doors to the hotel upon my arrival. Off of the lobby is the hotel’s restaurant, Makkasar. A French/asian fusion restaurant. As the hotel doesn’t have a concierge lounge, Gold and Platinum members get a free breakfast in the restaurant on weekdays. The breakfast is a full American breakfast that was really quite good. The breakfast included eggs, pancakes, sausages, oatmeal, mushrooms, potatoes, fruits, yogurts, cereal, and typical French pastries. I had e-mailed the hotel a couple days before arrival asking for an early check-in at 9am. When I arrived at 9am, it wasn’t quite ready, but was ready within 15 minutes of my arrival. It’s really nice to be able to check in early after a long flight from the US – so this really earned the hotel extra points in my opinion. Most hotels in Paris are pretty strict on the “no check-ins before 3pm” rule. As a platinum member, I was offered my choice of welcome gift. I picked 2 glasses of iced tea, and chocolates. The iced tea was a very interesting cinnamon flavored tea. But I think it’s a different type of iced tea each day. Heading up to my room, I went in to one of the two hotel elevators. Each elevator glows in a different color…… one glows with blue neon, and the other glows with red neon. The blue elevator is a bit more soothing than the red one. The room itself was relatively spacious, and continued with the dark wood tones from the lobby with bright pink accents on the bed. The room had the standard amenities, king bed, desk, desk chair, side chair. The room has a mini-bar that is only half-full, which leaves room for any beverages that you might want to keep cold. Two interesting items for sale on top of the mini-bar were an umbrella, and a power plug adapter. My sleep quality in the room was great. The room itself was very quiet. The bed was comfy. The air conditioning was cold when I wanted it to be, and warm when I wanted it to be warm. Unlike many Paris hotels, the air conditioning and/or heat works all year round here. Many older hotels in Paris will only offer heat *or* air conditioning depending upon the time of the year, which is always sucky on those hot days in the middle of winter when the air conditioning doesn’t work. The bathroom was nice and new, although a little dark as far as the lighting was concerned. The tub/shower had the typical French half/glass curtain. I always find these weird, because water seems to get everywhere when you don’t have a full curtain in the shower…. But maybe I’m just a messy shower taker. One of the coolest things in the room was actually in the bathroom… in the corner there was a piece of art with half of the Eiffel tower on it, then a mirror that reflected it, and made a whole Eiffel tower. See the video to understand what I mean. My room faced the interior courtyard of the hotel, so it also had a small balcony with a table and single chair. I always like being able to get fresh air in to a room, so the balcony was nice. The hotel really went overboard with the turn-down service each evening. My first evening, the turndown service included the regular chocolate you might expect, but also a bottle of wine, some olives, chips, and a small metal notepad. Each night the chocolates and office supply item were different, and there was also a printed weather forecast for the next day. My 2nd evening, there was the chocolate again, and also another notepad, but this time with post-it notes inside. And on my final evening, again the chocolate, and a paper holder to be used on a desk. I’ve never been in a hotel with office supplies as part of the turndown service… but I was always excited to come back to the room to see what was going to show up that evening. Much better than the just the standard mint on the pillow. Each floor of the hotel has its own small ice machine, that in addition to dispensing ice, also dispenses filtered water. My only real complaint staying here is that the internet was extremely slow. I don’t know if they were having issues, but it took like 15 minutes to download a 5 megabyte file. For a high-end hotel, this is really something they should fix. Overall a very nice hotel, in a convenient location in central Paris. I’ve also stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche, and the Renaissance Trocadero, and this one is my favorite of the three.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: Al_travel_10
Reviews.Content: Was able to spend 2 days at this hotel recently and it more than lived up to expectations. Very friendly, multi-lingual staff - directed us to a terrific residential neighborhood a couple blocks north of the hotel for great local dinners in smaller, out of the way restaurants. Very clean, hip and comfortable hotel - walk out the front of the building, look right and there's the Arc de Triomphe right there. 2 blocks south of the Tiernes stop on the number 2 subway made it very convenient as we took the Eurostar over from England. All and all, I don't think you can beat this hotel for location, price and comfort. Would stay there again with no questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: turbolaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a trip to Paris. Lovely hotel with all the conveniences. Our room was nice and spacious, plenty of room for two women's luggage and accoutrements. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning, which was basic (pastries, yogurt and granola, a few warm choices), but tasty. We were close to the Charles de Gaulle-Etoile Metro station with many subway options (or you can take a beautiful walk to the Eiffel Tower or Louvre, as we did). The main downside is that you're in the touristy Champs Elysee area, so there's less available in terms of inexpensive bites and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Used all my Marriot points and it was worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Karenkinm
Reviews.Content: We had only 2 days to spend in Paris so we needed a central location to make the most of the time we had. We were able to get into our room early in the morning after our overnight flight, which was greatly appreciated. Our room was enormous by European standards, very modern and clean, and quite comfortable. Even with the overcast skies, the view from the hotel balcony overlooking the Parisian rooftops was glorious. We were able too purchase Hop On ticket buses from the hotel, saving us more time. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the bus stop on the Champs Elysee. After a day of sightseeing, we had dinner in one of the many cafes along Wagram Avenue, and we felt perfectly safe in the vicinity of the hotel after dark. We had no trouble sleeping in the hotel bed which was supremely comfortable. We checked out early on day 2, and the hotel stored our luggage in a locked room until late afternoon. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Just wow.”
Reviews.Author: furballs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected in large part based on TA reviews, and it did not disappoint. From the experience in advance (emails inviting questions, and fast responses), to the departure, it was a great experience. Lovely contemporary design. Lobby lit with candles every night. Little gifts left in room each night (keychain, little books, chocolates, stuff like that). Welcomed for our 15th anniversary with a very nice bottle of champagne and box of French chocolates. Great location 5 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe and Metro station. Check in staff was warm and welcoming. Room was bright, big and cheerful. Excellent bed. Bathroom is huge, rainfall-type shower. Housekeeping staff made this room spotless every day. Room service meal was outstanding. One dinner in hotel was so-so, meat quite undercooked, but maitre d' took care of the issue well. Concierge service was great. Lots of help with directions, change, little things like that. Bellhops were out in pouring rain to find cabs for us. Every single time we came in or out, staff ran to open doors and say hello. Cheerfully listened to my terrible French, politely responded in French until I asked for English (unlike the usual Parisian rude ignoring of my attempt, and just talking in English).
