For a romantic experience, I recommend absolutely. All in all, phenomenal experience, this hotel is aspiring to be 5-star and should be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Us”
Reviews.Author: Asheville64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights using our Marriot points in late September. We were greeted and treated as if we were very important guests. The hotel is in a safe/convenient location, very stylish, great breakfast, very comfortable room, and has a very good restaurant. We ate in the hotel's restaurant (outside terrace) our last night and had an excellent dinner. Fanny, our waitress, made our meal even more special as did the restaurant manager as they provided us truely outstanding service. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: mbreggar
Reviews.Content: It has been a few months since our week long stay at the Arc de Triomphe "Ren". Oh, how we miss our friends on staff and the fabulous, lovely hotel. We keep thinking about the great, stylish property and the attentiveness of the staff. The hotel is in a wonderful, convenient location. Designed in a hip style and furnished in a warm manner, this hotel outclasses so many of the ultra high profile Paris hotels in every way. It is attention to detail that distinguishes the better hotels from the pretenders. And every detail was attended to during our stay. On top of that, the staff is the friendliest, most competent team I have had the pleasure to meet during my decades of business travel. Well done, Ren!! We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever in Paris!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel I was checked in to a Junior Suite by the most friendly hotel staff in Paris... Room 401 with a view of the inner courtyard, the biggest room I had so far in Paris... Cleaned well every day. The location is 3 minutes walking to the Arc de Triomphe, with metro stop for easy connections all through Paris. Breakfast in the morning is extensive with warm and cold buffet in the design restaurant Makassar. Also had 2 times dinner in this restaurant, which is a combination of a lounge bar with DJ and a restaurant. Food perfect here, as well as the staff! (Thank you so much Sarah).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a decent area”
Reviews.Author: Leah D
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris this fall and stay in this hotel for 2 nights on Marriott points. The rooms were nice and a comfortable size with very modern furniture. The bed was comfortable and the shower was pretty good. The room was fairly clean by there was some grime in the bath tub. Seemed like a standard Marriott just dressed up to look modern. We were offered a free brunch but didn't take advantage because we wanted to get an early start and brunch didn't start until late morning. The neighborhood felt safe and was close to the subway, but it seemed a bit touristy / businessy - not a lot of local flavor. The concierge/staff were nice and helpful but seemed a bit annoying that we weren't eating at the hotel restaurant or spending any money at the hotel. Overall - good hotel but not sure that it's worth the high price (or points).

Reviews.Title: “Veery good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel, mostly on personal business. This is an attractive property, close to city center and public transportation, with an attentive staff. The room was a good size, particularly for an European hotel. The bed was typically Marriott (comfortable). This is a new hotel with plenty of electrical outlets and a modern heating and cooling system. It has a nice if somewhat expensive restaurant. I would stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and colleagues. However, I do have few complaints. The hotel advertises as having wireless internet in each room. Our connection was so weak as to be almost useless for our smart phones and tablet. I couldn't use skype for my phone calls. Although the hotel is very modern in appearance, I think there are some oversights with the lighting in the bathroom and closet. I could also hear the baby crying in next room. I would also have liked to have had a concierge lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: rbodner890
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris for the first time last May. Staying at the Renaissance was the icing on the cupcake that is Paris in the springtime. The rooms were new, beds were comfy, and the beautiful courtyard was perfect for cocktails in the evening. The residential upscale neighborhood has great restaurants and east metro access. We loved Victor Hugo circle, especially when it was buzzing in the afternoon with children after school. Very different from the really touristy. Quiet and sophisiticated. Very helpful concierges, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: WiscBill3
Reviews.Content: I just completed a very enjoyable stay at the hotel. The staff, as others have noted, is excellent. My room was ready upon arrival. The room was large by European standards, with a good work area. As a gold member, I was given free internet access (which stopped working the second day) and complimentary breakfast, as there is no conceirge lounge as at other Marriott properties. The service at breakfast is great, but the food and variety is so-so. I would not have paid for it. The location is great with easy access to both the RER and metro. The Air France Line 2 bus stop is a short walk away. Only two small problems and one medium one: The fitness is small and when I was there about 1/3 of the equipment was out of order. On the second night, the wing I was in lost power for about 20 minutes, so I could not work or pack. There was no phone call to the room and when I called to the desk there was no answer. I eventually got through and power was restored shortly after. The medium problem is that the only draft beer in the bar is Heineken. In Paris, one should be able to have Kronenbourg 1664.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: apwill
Reviews.Content: Choosing a suitable hotel to celebrate getting engaged was never a question thanks to the fantastic experience we had last time we visited Paris from the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel staff. It was probably a case of hotel first, location second. Our decision, to no suprise, was spot on. The level of service and the thought that had be put into our reservation was nothing short of exemplary.The room was perfect and I cannot express how they have truely exceeding all my expectations once again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a visit”
Reviews.Author: Kingy_Geoff
Reviews.Content: Very good, clean hotel in a perfect location for visiting the main places in the city. The staff were polite and helpful and the bar and restaurant were warm and friendly. The breakfast was good and plentiful and set us up well for the day. Our room was large and spotless, and we were greeted on our arrival with a complimentary bottle of wine. The concierge was helpful, gave advice and made bookings etc. for us that made our stay easier. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a quality base for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “You will be sorry if you don't stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: huggyr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a wonderful young energetic staff who are very helpful and knowledgeable. Reserved a cab for the airport and had the best cab ride in Paris! Driver was very courteous and cautious. Really liked all the restaurant staff, especailly the bartender who was great. Would definitely come back when in Paris. Highly recommend this hotel for any sort of trip. They definitely go out of their way to make your stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location, Friendly Helpful staff...expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: RonanCarey
Reviews.Content: Stayed weekend of 29th-31st Oct 2011. Location is excellent, staff were very helpful and friendly - big thanks to Xavier (concierge) for all his advice! Room was great - quiet and a lovely balcony (though weather didn't allow sunbathing!). No complaints other than be prepared for a VERY expensive breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, breakfast not at the same level”
Reviews.Author: ErikCleppe
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's a very beautiful hotel at a perfect location. There is a lot of light in the room and there is a good smell in the corridors and room. The size of the room is good and the bathroom is clean. The service upon check-in was friendly, but we got asked 2 times (during check-in & check-out) why we were only staying for one night and they could easily extend our stay. For us, that wasn't really appreciated. The breakfast was another story. Where the hotel was near perfection, the breakfast was not good at all. The juices weren't any good, the bread & vienoisserie was of very poor quality. The choice in my opinion was pretty limited, compared to Kempinski, Marriot, Westin chains. The waiter was stumbling around like he has the worst job in life. Especially for the price you pay (28 € ) it is really not worth it. Last remark, we were not informed about the *free* wireless access at all. When in our room, we could get on the net, but it prompted us for payment... Some information at time of check-in would be useful. Overall , a good hotel to stay / sleep, but go have breakfast elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pb650
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel. From the bell desk to check-in to the room to the restaurant to all staff interactions, this hotel was outstanding. There is a sincere focus on meeting all the needs and expectations of guests in a warm and hospitable fashion - all too absent at hotels these days. In fact, I would dare to state that the customer service experience at this hotel was on a par with the service level I have experienced at Four Seasons hotels, if not better. Bravo to the management and staff, and thank you. The property looks new. The rooms are large by European standards, and are among the best thought out anywhere with regard to ventilation, lighting, bath facilities, linens, furniture, beds, and internet access. The restaurant has exceptional French and Indonesian fare, all served by attentive wait staff. The breakfast was a superb value, and the buffet had everything for both continental and English breakfasts. This is a brilliant hotel, and I can only hope to return soon to experience their unique brand of hospitality again.

Reviews.Title: “5* Accommodation, 5* Service”
Reviews.Author: thebrownfamily6
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe to celebrate my parents' 70th birthdays. The hotel is perfectly situated within walking distance of the Arc and Champs Elysee. From the moment we arrived everything was perfect. We booked two of the 'cheapest' rooms available and I have to say they were amazing - good size, beautiful bathrooms, small balcony with one chair overlooking the courtyard, stunning decoration. The management had kindly put complimentary bottle of champagne in my parents rooms and chocolates and also put a bottle of chilled wine in our room, what a lovely touch. The hotel is fairly small and has a 'boutique' feel about it, everyone is friendly and professional. Words cannot express how pleased I was with this hotel - this trip was a present for my parents and I really wanted everything to be perfect and it certainly was. Would not hesitate to recommend. Have a look at their official website and what you get is exactly what you get in the photos!! Book and enjoy!! Also, if you have the money do the Dinner River Cruise with hotel pick up and the horse and carriage ride through Paris - book worth every penny - we booked via Viator.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: puppyjake
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent 5 nights at the Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel in August 2011 and had a great trip. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Paris - you can walk to to Arc de Triophe and to the Champs Elysee - and you're a 2 min walk to a major metro station which will take you anywhere else in Paris. I'm a gold member with Marriott so we recieved a daily free breakfast in the restaurant which was delicious and also were the recipients of a very nice welcome gift upon arrival (Champagne, chocolates, a little book and also some other snacks). The room was lovely - very clean, very quiet, great bathroom, very very comfy bed which was wonderful after a long flight from Miami. We loved our little balcony overlooking the courtyard and we appreciated the high tech modern look to the rooms. I think perhaps the best thing in the hotel were the concierges - they were super super helpful - they gave us many great restaurant recco's and they booked us whereever we wanted to go and switched the bookings when we kept changing our minds! They were super helpful booking activities - they booked us the eiffel tower time (which i fully advise to do as this minimises your wait time to go up), they booked us into a fantastic comedy show (how to be a Parisian - very funny - all in English), we couldn't get tickets to the Moulen Rouge - but they were able to get us great tickets to the Lido revue show which is on the Champs Elysee and is supposedly as good if not better than the Moulin Rouge. The concierges really went above and beyond when we decided last minute on the Sunday that we wanted to take a tour of Paris in a 2CV car...the car was there within 2 hours of us asking if it possible to take the tour...they called 2 or 3 companies for us and had it all arranged as we ate lunch...this was the highlight of our trip - as we zipped around all the famous Paris land marks in the iconic 2CV car - gave us some great photo's and the guide was excellent and spoke fluent English - also we went on a Sunday which is a great day to tour in a car as the traffic is lighter. All in all i would highly reccommend the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe - as a wonderful, relaxing and quite place to stay in the center of Paris...and make sure you talk to the concierges - they'll be sure to make your trip even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “A premier neighborhood deserves a very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Serviceprof
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel meets and exceeds all the service requirements a seasoned traveler would expect - friendly acknowledgement by doorman/valet, speedy check- in, courtesy call post check-in to verify satisfaction, etc., etc. They also have certified concierges on staff who are very knowledgeable about local events, hot restaurants, and the general "buzz" of the neighborhood. Took Michel's suggestion and experienced a great bistro outing within two blocks of hotel!! Located in one of Paris' hidden gems of a neighborhood (Trocadero) this hotel is convenient to Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, and Eiffel Tower. Two metro stops are within a 5 minute walk from hotel and connect directly to all lines as well as RER trains. Kudos to staff for making us feel like very welcome guests. We certainly will keep this hotel on our "top tier" list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lottapud
Reviews.Content: We have just left after spending 5 days at this hotel. First we were welcomed to our room with a bottle of wine and chocolate covered nuts...what a nice surprise! The rooms were large especially by european standards. The service was excellent with all of the staff speaking very good english. The concierge was very helpful and helped us secure reservations for dinner two nights we were there...thanks Chloe! The location made getting around extremely easy as it is between two metro stations (Charles de Gualle - Etoile and Ternes). The rooms were kept very clean by an excellent housekeeping staff. Lastly breakfat was great too with a variety of hot dishes as well as plenty of cereals and fruit! If you have the chance definitely stay here as it lives up to all the excellent reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Perfection ~ will return!”
Reviews.Author: barthic
Reviews.Content: This hotel excelled on all levels, from the time I booked all the way through to checkout! (With one minor exception at departure) Traveling with my daughter and her 10 mo. old baby boy held multiple challenges. We had finished a 4 city tour of England arriving Paris for a quick tour before embarking on a road trip to visit friends in Central France. Upon check in, our front desk agent pointed out they did have availability for a 2nd night if we desired to extend our stay. One look at my daughter's weary face, minding the baby and our luggage, I asked her opinion and she was thrilled with the prospect of resting in the same place for 2 nights instead of moving on after just 1 night. I know this seems like a silly detail, but it felt like he was reading my mind and anticipating our needs without my having to say a word! Refreshingly gracious personnel always succeed in winning loyalty, whatever your travel circumstances. This gentleman certainly won mine. Every member of the staff here spoke flawless English and clearly was at the service of their guests. I must have really looked stressed at our check-in, because in the evening, the front desk mgr. sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne along with a variety of snack crisps ~ another winning move that really helped my daughter and I relax after a busy day. It is genuinely kind gestures like these, though small details, that can create an awesome, welcoming visit vs. an average/good hotel stay. THIS RENAISSANCE is AWESOME! The room was spacious and the porta-crib was already in place for the baby's much needed morning nap. We had a mini-balcony overlooking a quiet courtyard which we preferred over the street facing view. The bathroom was roomy & state of the art with every convenience and amenity. Their renovation was thorough and impressive! Delightfully located just 4 blocks down the slope from the Arc de Triomphe says it all. Everything is either a leisurely stroll or cab ride away. Superbly convenient, especially if it is your very FIRST visit to Paris! Our plans, sadly, had to be altered due to a feverish, teething infant and the hotel staff, once again went above & beyond offering an additional night at the same rate which we gladly took them up on. One of the concierge had experience as a nanny/au pair and offered suggestions for the baby's discomfort and to call a Doctor, if we felt it was necessary. In the end, we decided not to proceed with our trip to Central France and instead chose to return to England on the Eurostar. I had already picked up my rental car, though, and this caused a panic if we were to make our scheduled train, how could I return the car to the agency AND make it to the station on time? Our decision was very last minute, granted, but I begged the concierge to assist in having the car delivered to or picked up by, our car rental co. He declined on both counts. I managed to get the car back to the agency in mid-day traffic, but it was a brutal experience that added more stress to an already dreadful situation. Everything worked out in the end, thankfully, and baby recovered. We are thankful for all the care and assistance of the compassionate staff at this Renaissance. Though it was an abrupt end to our French Adventure, this hotel won loyal guests forever! No amount of advertising money can compare to the firsthand experience at a first class property like this one.

Reviews.Title: “A well located small hotel that delivers”
Reviews.Author: Geddes_7
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe is well located - the Metro is less than 5 minutes away, so too the Arc de Triomphe and the top of the Champs d'Lysees. Picking a hotel in Paris is always a challenge - do you go for traditional ? Do you stay on the left bank ? Do you go for room size and comfort ? Do you go for access to transport ? After much debate we elected to stay at the Renaissance and didn't regret the decision. The rooms are larger than the "standard" Paris hotel room. Our room looked out over a courtyard and had a small balcony. It was peaceful and quiet - always a bonus in Paris. The room was very functional and had all the amenities you would want. The decor is clean and modern. My only grumble and this is a small one - take time to get used to the very bright lights in the elevators ! They are very bright. The staff were particularly helpful and obliging - nothing was ever a problem. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant - it was one of the best buffets I have seen in Europe. Price Value wise, the full breakfast price was excellent, the continental less so, but remember that Paris is after all an expensive city. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would return in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: sslaugh182
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel.. all the positive reviews are not exagerating.. service , staff the very best... and one thing not mentioned.. this hotel has a wonderful aroma- honestly... I actually inquired and was told the aroma is by design... and only for this hotel.. that is my one negative.. wish I could have it and purchase it for my home.. it begins when you first walk in the hotel.. so very understated and then each time you come into the hotel... you take in the beautiful scent I know that sounds so ridiculous as your looking for postiive or negative reviews..but honestly everyone who has said how great the rooms are, the service, the wonderful beds, linens, cleanliness are all right about this wonderful place! The staff is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Drgeis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September 2011 using Marriott points (lots of them!) for eight nights. My positive impressions began months before arrival, when I enlisted their exceptionally professional concierges to make dinner reservations, suggest dining options, and even procure socccer tickets. (Thanks again Chloe & Cedric!) The hotel itself is a boutique-sized place, with modern (but not cold) appointments. It is a three or four minute walk from the metro station below the Arc de Triomphe (nice to see each night when we returned to the hotel) which allow rapid access to pretty much anywhere in the city. There are quite a few very good restaurants in the neighborhood (Guy Savoy, Chez Gabrielle, Le Hide) as well as several cafes along the walk to the Arc metro, and the Champs Elysees has decent shopping (also five minutes away) Our room was spacious, modern, quiet and clean, and the bed and pillows were VERY comfortable. From check-in to departure, all staff members we encountered were competent and very pleasant. Robert, in the bar, was a standout, even if he didn't have a great selection of beers for me. Complaints? Breakfast in the hotel restaurant our last morning was a good bit overpriced, and with as many American guests as they have, I'd like to have seen ESPN on the TV options. That's about it, though. You've got hundreds of hotel options in Paris. This is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: esterla
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days in this hotel ,the service was great the location was excellent 10 min from the famous street champs-elysee you have many restaurants around ,the hotel style is elegant with luxury furnitures ,the room was very large ,comfortable and modern with nice city view, but I really was disappointed about the Cleanliness: the linens and the bed cover were very dusty and it s not feet the persons with allergy when the housekeeper clean the room you can see a lot of dust flying on the air, when I shared the problem with the reception because I have kids with allergy they told me you can change the room but you have to pay extra because it s a suite!!!!!!!!!???

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Paris, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conniemama
Reviews.Content: So glad we switched to this hotel. It was so nice to be close to everything. The front desk was very helpful. We used the concierge evey day, and were never disappointed. Our room was so nice. It was good sized and very comfortable. My only gripe was the lack of wi-fi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with great location”
Reviews.Author: Pathcat
Reviews.Content: Great location very close to the Arc de Triomphe and therefore convenient for the Air France Bus I took after my arrival at the Orly airport. Check in was very friendly and efficient and the clerk spoke perfect English. There is not a large check-in desk, but a single podium. The hotel is very modern with minimalist decorating, so if you are looking for traditional French decor, this is not your place. I stayed in a Paris Sky View suite that had a large king bed with a very large balcony that overlooked the street with great views to the Arc and the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The bed was comfortable but took up most of the room space. Also included was a Nespresso coffee machine and a very nice bathroom with robe and slippers. The best part of the room is the view and that is what you pay for. There was nightly turn down service in which they left a little gift each night; this was cute and much appreciated. The breakfast buffet was included in the room rate and included a good array of hot and cold items including yummy smoothies. I did not eat any other meals at the restaurant so I can't comment on that. Again, a convenient location to many attractions, especially if you like to walk in one of the world's best walking cities. The concierge, sorry I can't remember his name, was great in arranging some shipment of some small items for me. The only thing I can fault the hotel is the cost for the space, otherwise the quality and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Only the best...”
Reviews.Author: Otodoc
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to this hotel and for good reason-great location, beautiful rooms and phenomenal service. The staff goes out of there way to make your visit memorable. From early access to a room upon a long trip overseas to complimentary beverages and snacks. One block from the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysee and metro station. World class restaurant in hotel and fabulous breakfasts. I can not say enough great things about this hotel. Experience it yourself! They are also one of the few luxury hotels to have "family" rooms that accommodate a family of 4 comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: yello815
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 city trip through Europe and this was easily the best hotel of them all. Having been dissatisfied by another hotel that our travel agent booked us on, we ended up on at the Renaissance and were extremely satisfied. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful and courteous (which I can't say we experienced from any other of the 5 hotels we stayed at in Europe) and the rooms were beautiful and smelled so good. We had a great view from our room with a nice balcony. It was also easily the most comfortable bed of our entire stay with luxurious linens. Also, the gifts that were left in our room were always a nice surprise which made the hotel shine all the more. The location was great and the amenities surpassed our expectations. We only wish that they provided internet for free. Thanks Renaissance for being the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the 5 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: malone44
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, the staff were great they were very polite, attentive and friendly nothing was any hassle. It was our 10th anniversary and they made it very special. The room was very large, clean and modern we had a fab balcony looking over the city. I recommend this place it is great and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms, and Service”
Reviews.Author: que-public
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 out of 5 stars Rooms: 5/5 stars Beds: 4/5 stars Service: 6/5 (above and beyond) Concierge: 4/5 stars Breakfast: 5/5 stars Value for the money: 4/5 stars This hotel is located one block from Metro Charles De Gaulle - Etoille, very convenient to the Arc, Champs-Elysees, or - more importantly - to Faurbourg. Walking distance to Madeleine, Taillevent, and Angle. Rooms are nice and large (mine was 32 sq. meters) My room's entire front wall was made of glass, and it was full of light. Bed was standard Renaissance king with goose down upper and was very nice. Large work desk. Rooms were cleaned well, linens were of good quality. The staff at the front desk were outstanding, every one I talked with. I had a number of requests of them, including a request concerning special accommodation, and they never disappointed. Concierge and bell staff were all great. Breakfast was outstanding. Variety, freshness, service were all very good. The hotel's restaurant is also quite good, we had dinner there and enjoyed it. A bit on the expensive side - but good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Truly elegant”
Reviews.Author: Engshosho
Reviews.Content: Im so in love with every thing about this hotel. The rooms are spacious the staff is super friendly and helpful.the complementary stuff they leave in your room every day. The other day i forgot a very expensive watch on the desk for afull day and came to find it in the same place. I would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: This hotel recently draws consistently good reviews from Tripadvisor. I decided to try out this hotel for the trip. The photos and pictures seems to suggest at the very least, decent accommodations. As for the price, everything in Paris is ridiculously expensive so compared to other hotels, the rate can be considered as competitive. Arriving The pre-arrival welcome and follow up is good. As it was my first trip to Paris, I asked the Concierge a lot of questions. While not always the best answer, at least they bother to reply very promptly with quite complete information. Few days prior my arrival, the hotel sent several emails to check and ask if I have any specific request. I requested for a bathroom with walk-in shower. The treatment I received when I actually arrived was considerably less welcoming. I arrived by taxi and had to toll my own luggage bags into the lobby while a bell man just stand and pretend not to see me looking at a piece of paper. I supposed he is the bellhop in charged for calling cabs and not to handle luggage. The check-in process was a bit better and quick, I went up the guest room myself. On entering the room, there’s a bottle of Red wine and a box of chocolates offered with compliments from the hotel and also a welcome letter. The Room Once again please be reminded that this is Paris and everything is ridiculously expensive. So despite paying Euro400+ a night, and booked a what the hotel called “Prestige Room”, it’s actually very small, not more than 30m2 and with the large bed taking up much of the room. There’s a walk-in shower as per my request but no bathtub. The fittings used are of the cheap Ikea quality. The bed is too soft for me, sort of sinks down. And the working desk is very small. The TV only carry local channels when I browse through. Most of the furniture and fittings are of medium-range quality and the hotel website did a good job to make it look more appealing than in real life. Basically, this room is functional if one only used it for sleep and bath and nothing more. I also notice the usual missing amenities such as mineral water and dental kit ( which can be requested ). The toiletries were never replenished. No slippers provided. Basically the hotel only provide the bare essentials. In Asia, we will call this 3-star. But well, this is Europe and Paris, one of the most expensive city in the world. One more note, the internet is free for my room type, but it's very slow. Common Areas and Location Nothing much really because all the hotel has is a restaurant + lounge. The lobby is non-existent really, basically just a place for guest to check-in and check-out. But then, most hotels in Paris are like that. There is a lounge though with quite nice décor and a restaurant which we didn’t bother to try. The hotel is well located though, within short walk distance to the Arc de Triomphe and the shopping district of Champs-Elysee. It’s also near a metro station but use this with upmost caution as metro stations in Paris are infested with pickpockets and scam artists. Service Service is well, just basically OK but I think this hotel runs on minimum staff. Request for ice got a call back to say all service staff are busy and would I mind taking it myself from across the guest hallway? And on a way more serious note, I unfortunately become a victim of pickpocketing in Paris by one of those low-life scumbags in a Paris Metro. The hotel did provide the address of the police station to report the incident but that’s about it. I also think this happened so often that they are kind of ambivalent about it. While the pre-arrival letters and email sound very welcoming, the actual delivery of the service is lukewarm. Just don’t expect too much. I was also charged 67 Euros to make a 10 mins emergency phone call, a ridiculously exorbitant amount. Conclusion I suppose if you only need a place to sleep and take a bath, in a good location, this hotel does delivers. However, for the price, I think one can do a lot better by either pay less for more economical accommodation or slightly more to stay at a real luxury hotel. The Renaissance seems neither here nor there. I rate it a 3 out of 5, ie just adequate and think many of the rave reviews here in Tripadvisor are suspiciously over the top positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent location..definately 5 *”
Reviews.Author: TAS75
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure to stay in, from the moment we arrived we were treated like royality. Location is perfect 5 minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Its easy to get to from the airport we caught the RER train and made one change on the metro only cost EUR8. We were very lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite and what can I say it was amazing, especially when we also received a lovely bottle of red wine and a gift for my partners daughter. We didnt eat at the hotel as there are plenty for restaurants and bars in the immediate vacinity. The next day we did the red bus open top tour which took 2 hours but we managed to get in all the sights in a short space of time. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and next time im in Paris would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Staff, Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: DLV222
Reviews.Content: Great experience from the minute you enter till the minute you leave. The staff could not do enough for us. The concierge even got us reservations for the early show at the Moulan Rouge ( I had been trying for months). The perfect location for a family vacation in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris accommodation”
Reviews.Author: boorg78
Reviews.Content: Sprnt a weekend for our wedding date.Very boutique like hotel near the Arc. A lot of nice coffe shops and restaurants so we did not dine in the hotel.Very clean rooms with very nice decor. not really american setting which was nice.Good service and very helpfull front desk!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: llive2travel
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a great location. More like a boutique hotel. Very convenient to all attractions with 2 metro stops nearby. Lots of cafes/restaurant sin the area. I like that it is not in a touristy area, like Rue Rivoli, but if you like that kind of stuff, Champs Elysees is a few minutes walk away. Nice room furnishings, comfortable bed, great bathroom but not enough lighting to put make up on. Concierge was very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Attention and Location”
Reviews.Author: hugo0001
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights mid of august. The hotel is at 5 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe in a very safe lit street (Av. Wagram) there are 2 Metro Stations about 5 minutes also that cover most of the metro system. There are several places to eat close to the hotel, if you dont like eating in the hotel. The gym is great and has plenty of equipment. The hotel has been recently refurbished, and the rooms and facilities are top notch - good spacious room - a bit pricey but you get what you pay for. Xavier, he concierge was very knowledgeable and very helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the great service and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris as a celebration of our 5-year anniversary. I was only hoping for a decent room when I typed a short note saying "anniversary trip, please take care of us" when booking. What we received was way above our expectation. Not only did we get a very nice room (spacious and well-equipped), but also a "royal treatment" with a bottle of Nicolas Feuillame champagne! That said, the general service is excellent. One of the best we ever received in Paris. The porters, receptionists,and navigator are all superbly polite. They also speak very good English. Location wise, the hotel sits in a relatively quiet street about two blocks from Champs Elysee. Arc de Triomphe is also 2 minutes away. Subway station Terne (line 3) is 200 yards away.Very convenient. This hotel will be our top choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very chic and great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieBlazers
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here to visit Paris with our family. The hotel is very well located, and being new it is very modern with good sized rooms and great facilities. We'll definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepdon
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - great location just steps away from a Metro stop, a short walk to Arc de Triomphe (and a larger Metro station), and close to numerous shops, restaurants, cafes, bistros, and so forth. The staff is ridiculously friendly and helpful, happy to switch to English, and full of excellent recommendations and advice - they steered us away from several tourist traps and guided us to some wonderful experiences. Rooms are modern, spacious, clean, and crisp, many with wonderful views of the city. The bar (just off the lobby) was quiet, with a friendly and enthusiastic bartender. On a trip that included a half-dozen hotels throughout Europe, this was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristolmember
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the bank holiday weekend of the royal wedding in April 2011. The hotel was in a excellent location a street down from the Arch de triomphe. The room we were given was large, clean, new and in a quiet part of the hotel. The beds were huge and comfortable and the bathroom was ample too- the walk in shower was so spacious. There was a quite a few complementary tolieteries in the room such as mouthwash etc which you don't get in all hotels which was a nice touch. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. We ate in the hotels restraurant 'Makassar ' which is pan asian and were extremely disappointed with the food. It was rather bland and extremely expensive it cost us over £100 euros for two starters, two mains and two glasses of chablis. The restaurant also serves french food but having heard an Amercian/Canadian couple complain about the tateless steak on the table next to us- it would appear that the french based food is not much better! The restaurant also had thumping house music blaring out from a live DJ which was unusual- not really sure what client group they are aiming for? We ate at a local Lebanese restraurant called Nai on rue du Faubourg saint- honore which is just a road down from the hotel. The food was reasonably priced and was extremely tasty . Would recommend this restaurant to everyone staying at the Renaissance. Paris is good to visit in the spring time the weather was fine and it was not too busy!

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ThemeParkMom
Reviews.Content: We couldn't decide between the Marriott Champs-Elysees or the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe (we were using points) and then I read reviews here on TripAdvisor. We chose the Renaissance because of the awesome reviews about their customer service, perfect location and the size of the rooms. We were thrilled with all three! We loved this hotel and all of the staff. They are so willing to go the extra mile to make sure you feel comfortable. They gave us great tips about where to shop and how to use the metro and taxis. The rooms were always well stocked with extra towels, clean glasses, adapters and several "gifts" throughout our stay. We have only been home for a couple of days and we already miss it. When we return to Paris - we will also return to Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe!!

Reviews.Title: “Competely happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteCinCA
Reviews.Content: We have our own place in Paris, but on our most recent visit we had renters arriving a few days before we wished to leave the city, so we turned to our Marriott points and booked this hotel. We're so glad we did! We were treated so well by the gracious staff and were upgraded to a Paris Sky View balcony room on the top floor--what a treat! From the large balcony we could see the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, and the was bed very comfortable. Will happily stay here again! Kudos to the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: SondraTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff was warm and friendly. Needed a roll away and they were quick to respond. Hotel was clean and quiet. My only complaint was when I asked the best way to get around the city, I was directed to the metro. This is perfect if you like to walk alot and go up and down alot of stairs. I don't mind walking or doing stairs, but it took us so long to figure out the metro that we missed being able to make it into the museum that afternoon. Afterwards, one of my relatives told me about the red or gold bus that travels around the city and let's you get on and off at various locations around the city.

Reviews.Title: “This will always be our Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again in April after a few visits. The location is perfect for all areas as Terne metro is a couple of minutes and is best for visiting Montmatre -our favourite and Charles de Gaulle Etoile the other way makes all of Paris within reach. The service is true five star. They knew that we were returning guests who had visited not long before. We upgraded our room to one of the new ones with the glass front and I'm glad we did although the other rooms are equally as impressive. So big for Paris and the small touches like the lighting in the bathroom give that extra luxurious feeling. The beds arethe comfiest ever for a hotel and actuallyinspired us to buy ourseles a new bed. The hotel kindly sent up a bottle of very good champagne, delicious french chocolates and a book of 'the most romanticplaces to kiss in Paris'. This gesture was lovely and really appreciated for our romantic break during the royal wedding bank holiday. The hotel had an iphone app which we used to find a restaurant locally. Concierge booked it for us and this was excellent. We usually eat in typically french bistros, cafes etc but this was a high end asian restaurant 'Kok Ping' and was in walking distance. Lovely meal, great service and a good recommendation. We will shortly return to Renaissance Arc De Triomphe and cannot wait.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: procpr
Reviews.Content: Loved the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. The hotel itself is lovely, with large rooms, nice flat screen tv with tons of international channels and a nice bar area. What really shines though, is the service and the prime location. When I arrived, a bottle of Bordeaux was awaiting us in the room. The beds are soft and comfy and the view is superb. All in all, a perfect Parisian experience. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Maotsejung
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely modern hotel that provided all the amenities we are used to from a luxury hotel in the states (king size bed, AC, spacious bed room and bathroom). What truly made our stay stand out was the gracious hospitality of the staff. Not only were they helpful within the hotel, but when they were off the clock at the bar down the street, they overheard us asking for directions and provide further help when it was not their duty. Small things that will draw us back again.

Reviews.Title: “I found my Paris go to hotel! Great stay, room, amenities, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: fitfunfab
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights before going to Juan de Pin and the French Rivera and my husband and i agree that we received much better service and all around positive experience at the Renaissance Paris Arc De Triomphe. With the modern decor (although we could have done without the funky blue and red lit elevators ), decent sized room, spacious wc, king size bed and balcony we enjoyed a very comfortable stay. We were also fortunate enough to stay on the top floor and we had a great view of the Arc as well as a nice city view from our room. Great location, with the Arc de Triomphe metro 2 blocks away and as a bonus the Air France shuttle also drops you off at the Arc de Triomphe, saving considerable taxi fare ( approx 60 euro for a taxi vs 15 euro per person for the shuttle). All the staff, check in, concierge, maitre de and bartender were pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable. It is rare that I give a totally positive review, but in this case. I am happy to do so, and look forward to returning to Paris and the Renaissance Arc De Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “You are next to the Arc de Triomphe in a great Hotel! What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Selayzim
Reviews.Content: In Paris usually the hotels are very "classic style"like a litle palace old fashioned just for you, but in the Renaissance you will find very modern rooms nice WC, great staff, good breakfast and a very nice concierge service. The rooms have a nice varanda, and if you want to spend a litle more you can enjoy a wine on it with the arc de triomfe and Eiffel tower view! Book this hotel and i am sure you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_traveller09
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel in a 'family room', very comfortable for the 3 of us. I had booked using Marriott points and a small charge for the larger room, and it proven to be an excellent value! The hotel is very close to the Arc de Triomphe and Etoile, which is especially convenient when using Air France Cars to go to Roissy-CDG airport. Our room was facing the inner court and so it was very quiet! When we checked in, our room was not ready, and when we got back more than 45 mins past the check in time (3pm), it was still not ready which was kind of annoying, but after this initial bad start everything was perfect. When we got back to our room after dinner, a bottle of wine and chocolates were waiting for us, the bathroom was refreshed, and nougat and a small Renaissance luggage tag was waiting on the beds. That was a nice touch! The room was very nice, with a Bosch espresso machine, small balcony with a chair and a table, fabulous beds, air conditioning very good and quiet, modern and impeccable bathroom. We did not have breakfast in the hotel restaurant, after all there are a lot of nice choices in Paris including Laduree or Paul on Champs Elysees, but the restaurant looked nice. We used the internet in their Business Center to check our flight, it was 5 Euro for 15 mins. I think this is a very nice hotel to stay in Paris, and being able to use Marriott points was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night in this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sse1078
Reviews.Content: What a surprise!! I was not expecting such a nice room or hotel. I booked through Amex and I received a great suite with a powder room, balcony, separate bedroom and living room and dining area. Bathroom included separate bathtub and shower and 2 sinks. Decor was very modern, which is not to my taste, but well done. Everything was very new and clean. My room had a tassimo espresso maker and also there was a bottle of wine and snacks waiting for me in my room. I didn't have the wine but the snacks were good! The staff was very helpful and kind. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to arc de triomphe but rest of area is very "businessy" apart from champs elysees. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in while visiting Paris and nicest at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM”
Reviews.Author: dreamgraph
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel in a top location. Sleek, but not intimidating. These clean and comfortable hotel rooms were large, compared to Paris standards. Ms. Marianne was welcoming and accommodating. The friendly concierge staff were helpful and informative. We look forward to our return trip back to Paris....and to Renaissance Arc de Triomphe! Thank you to the hotel for making our visit a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in 9 days in Europe”
Reviews.Author: GregandConnieNico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel through Lubeck and Hamburg Germany then to Vienna, Austria. Our trip ended in Paris at this hotel. The location was great to the subway and other attractions. The service was fantasitic, many english speaking emloyees. Our room was a delight. Even has a full king bed without the european twin push together plan. The breakfast buffet was delish, go if you can!! The front desk and the "navigators" were outstanding. The navigators made the trip much easier by setting things up for us. Sure we paid a little more for tickets but was well worth it. Would absolutely use this hotel again!!!!! Is a 30 min walk to tower but a 10 minute subway trip for 1,70 euro.

Reviews.Title: “After many stays, I have a favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cbmeier
Reviews.Content: I've had many pleasurable stays at Paris hotels, but I've never returned to any one hotel. I will return to the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe! The accommodations were wonderful and very very comfortable, the location was excellent, and the staff were extremely professional, attentive and hospitable. We had a very busy agenda, and the concierge provided excellent advice several times which made our visit most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily7778
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to Paris and stayed here. The hotel was more of a small boutique hotel. The rooms were very new and modern look and feel. Very cool. Our view was overlooking other buildings, not too wonderful. But the location of the hotel was perfect. We walked every day to all dining, METRO station, Champs Elyesses, Arc de Triomphe. I didn't take a cab at all while I stayed here. We were really lucky and happened to be staying at the hotel when ELEW performed at the hotel in a acoustic concert in the lounge. That was amazing, and an expereince not to be missed. I loved this hotel and the service, will definetely be back when I bring my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Carly82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a long weekend in April. The hotel is just a few hundred yards from the Arc de Triomphe. We had a fabulous room (overlooking the street with curvy window!), very comfortable and luxurious. The only time we ate at the hotel was at breakfast, which was always of a high standard and had lots of choice. The hotel bar is very funky with a DJ playing some nights. We often went for a pre and post dinner drink and always appreciated the complimentary snacks! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SKCJHC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little removed from the heart of Paris, but that turned out to be a very nice thing! We were just a block from the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro, so it was easy to get anywhere. We were so close to the Champs-Elysees but did not have anywhere near the crowds! Breakfast buffet was wonderful...but I could not get the idea of iced tea across to them! Room was very spacious and loved having a bathtub to soak our feet at the end of each day! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stew7601
Reviews.Content: We began a 2-week honeymoon trip through Europe with 4 nights in Paris. As a Platinum member, I've stayed in several Marriott properties in Paris before, but this one blew them all away. It feels more like a boutique than a chain hotel. The service could not have been better. Champagne and desserts were waiting us in our room. We e-mailed the concierge before we even arrived to make one dinner reservation, which he did, and then another while there, which they confirmed with a handwritten note to our room. The room itself was very modern, spacious. We paid a little extra to have a balcony overlooking the courtyard (though we didn't end up using it much). And you can't ask for a much better location -- tucked away from the crowded tourist area, but just a 5-minute walk from the Arc and the start of the Champs Elysees, if you want to begin sightseeing. Our breakfast was included with the room, and they do offer a nice buffet, but I would not pay the regular $20-plus euros for it. One of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JRL46
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the rooms spacious even by US standards and the staff very accommodating. The front desk and concierge service were wonderful. This hotel is two blocks from the Arc, two blocks from a metro station and one block from a laundromat which turned out to be very handy because we were on an extended trip. The location is relatively quiet compared to the Champs Elysees which is a very short walk away. I'd stay here again! Very quiet for a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay...”
Reviews.Author: PastorTed
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and we couldn't have picked a better place. Yes, the room was great, the view was great, but what made this amazing was their concierge, and mainly Xavier. From even before we arrived, their assistance with train travel within France, their help with a rental car, etc. was very prompt and accurate. Xavier recommended restaurants, helped us figure out the Metro, and even helped us with some key french sayings! When Xavier wasn't there, his associate Cedric was equally as helpful and courteous. Some of our friends had said the location of this hotel was not ideal, but we found it to be just the opposite. We loved the neighborhood it was in with many great restaurants, and it was close to the Metro. If we were to return to Paris we would stay here again. And by the way, our room was quite large, something we have heard from many of our friends who have been to Paris that this is usually not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Very glitzy hotel, beware of comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: tsantos85
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we thought we'd see the LED's illuminating the wavy designed front, but were disappointed to see that they were off the nights that we were there. The interior design was fantastic - and the room was even more amazing. The bathroom was kind of strange - just a piece of glass dividing part of the shower with the rest. When we first turned on the water we thought we were going to flood the bathroom! The bedroom was a favorite throughout our time in Europe. The size of the room was very large and it was really tough getting out of bed in the morning to go sightseeing!! I don't know if this is really common in Europe, but I don't think any 5 star hotel should be charging their guests money for using their business center. The concierge was kind of a jerk too - he had this matter of fact tone when asked simple questions which seemed pretty arrogant. Overall, I think the hotel IS amazing and in the high end area of Paris. Definitely worth the stay for any special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch.”
Reviews.Author: SurreyJoe
Reviews.Content: Very modern and swish.Fantastic and friendly staff.Centrally located as the name says. .Never had a 5 course breakfast before,but possible here.Something for everyone. Expensive ----but necessary now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LadyWhoLunchesLots
Reviews.Content: Great location just by the Arc de Triomphe. Great friendly staff and clean modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The room, amenities, location was nice”
Reviews.Author: emmi16
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel that I stayed in during this trip in terms of my enjoyment of the room/atmosphere and location . It was expensive for a room that was a little smaller than I'd hoped for and with no good view. But overall the comfort, amenities and great location made up for it. I thought the decor was visually pleasing. The bathroom was a decent size, although the shower was strange-no shower curtain or containment of water. So half the bathroom is wet when you shower. The staff were polite and helpful in the beginning and when I called before my arrival to confirm my reservation.,At the time I checked in I mentioned that I might require a late check out, and was told by the person on duty at the time I could check out by 3PM no problem. But later on during my stay dealing with diffrent employees,I found that they were not so polite and helpful when I wanted to make sure it was noted on my file Checkout by 3PM. At first I was told there were no rooms available-all sold out b/c the weekend was starting (Friday afternoon) so I'd have to check out by 12PM. Since I had an appointment at 11:30AM there was no way I could get back to the hotel by 12PM to check out. An employee told me directly something along the lines of, ":we want to make money and sell all our rooms so you have to get out".I told them it would be a major inconvience to me if I had to check out before leaving for my appointment and I couldn't make use of the room for at least 15 minutes just to gather my things etc after returning for my appointment. I politely asked if they could allow me to check out just a bit later, no later than 2pm. Then despite being told that they were completely booked earlier I was told I could stay in the room until 6PM if I paid for half of another night's stay. I thought they said no rooms were available. This didn't surprise me. But I still don't like it especially when I am paying a lot for the room. I know customer service and PR skills are non-existant these days. Everyone is just after money and looking for any way possible to nickel and dime customers these days. Requesting a later checkout on previous trips normally was not a problem and the hotel staff was glad to do it. The staff here could have at least pretended to be nice to my face especially since this was a very expensive stay and it's supposed to be a 5 star hotel. Of course these days most people are not genuinely nice or polite, and they could care less about you, however they can just offer lip service. I don't care whatever negatives or negative attitude they have towards someone just as long as they pretend to act nice while I'm doing business w/them. Also after my request for a late checkout, all of my other requests were ignored, such as when I asked for a set of utensils, they were never delivered.So while service was not up to 5 star standards, I did enjoy the room and everything about the hotel as long as I didn't have to deal with staff., better service was expected especially at this price point. Overall I'd stay here again, but I wouldn't expect much in they way of customer service especially if you have a special request. They will NOT go above and beyond for you as I would have liked/expected considering how much it cost me to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Niagarax
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the family room with my wife and adult daughter for three days in June. The hotel is quite new and modern. The bathrooms are really modern and as good as any in North America. The location is quite convenient. A five minute walk from where the Air France shuttle bus drops you off. We were able to walk with our luggage to the hotel and had no trouble finding the place. Did not eat at the hotel.There are a number of good restaurants around.McDonalds five doors down. The air conditioning was not very good, even for early June. This may be an issue when it warms up a bit more. The staff were exceptionally nice, friendly and helpful. Had trouble working the coffee machine the first day and we were sent freshly brewed coffee instead.The business center charges to have you get on line.

Reviews.Title: “Awful view, nice room, RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: AndrewReese
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and large for a hotel room in Europe. However, our view was of this ugly deck behind the hotel. The concierge and the girl that checked us in were immediately rude to us when we checked in. The concierge actually insulted me when I asked for recommendations for dinner. It made our first night in Paris a bit uncomfortable. The rooms were outrageously expensive and I would have expected much better service for the price we paid for our room. For what we paid, I could have stayed anywhere in Paris, and I was very disappointed with this hotel. I would even venture to say it was the worst hotel we stayed at between London, Paris, Rome, and Venice. If I were the GM, I would do some training on dealing with international travellers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience - want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JoeWT
Reviews.Content: We recenly stayed with a family of four for five days at this hotel. I would say the room was expensive, but if you're looking for a place that complements your stay in Paris and doesn't detract from it, then this is a great selection. The room was very clean and very quiet, which was surprising given that a fairly busy street was right out front. The room was spacious, and the beds were very comfortable as well (2 queens). We all slept soundly, making our stay much more cheeful. The full breakfast was fantastic. No complaints at all; every family member with their unique tastes was happy. It was included in our room price, however, so I never had to pay the 28 euro cost per person. The amenities were great and included a welcome ice machine and a fantastic fitness room. The staff were, to a person, exceedingly friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English which proved helpful even though I spoke French moderatley well. The location was almost perfect. Just off the super touristy Champs Elysee yet only a four minute (exactly) walk to the metro station (Charles de Gaulle) with connections to just about anywhere in the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a nice hotel with space, comfort, and amenities to unwind and truly relax in between their daily forays throughout Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Clean, but falls short of five star service”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLal
Reviews.Content: We spent one week here in May. Our room was terrific--spacious, modern, in good condition. Fabulous bed. Every guest finds a bottle of wine and snacks presented in his/her room on the first night--a very nice touch. Internet in the room through IBahn was about 6 euros for an hour--not bad given the usual luxury hotel rates. Given the high quality of the room and the excellent location, we would probably stay here again. But there are some cons; 1. No bathtub. I gather there are few rooms with tubs so be sure to request this if it matters to you. 2. Be wary of recommendations from the concierge staff . One of the concierge staff recommended a tourist trap restaurant to us (a restaurant identified on tripadvisor as being a tourist scam). After that, we found our own places to eat through tripadvisor. 3. Room Service breakfast was not great. My suggestions if you stay here: -try the croissant takeout place (Croissantiere, I think) a few doors down Avenue de Wagram towards the Arc de Triomphe -I highly recommend Chez Gabrielle, a small restaurant, around the corner from the hotel on Rue d'etoile (about 100 euros for a three course meal for two with half a bottle of wine and bottle of mineral water). -Do get a Paris Museum Pass (I ordered mine online and it came in the mail without a problem) since the lineups at the Louvre and the Musee D'orsay can be over an hour. You may not save that much money on admission, but you'll be very grateful to avoid the long lineups. -For lunch at the Louvre with a refined atmosphere, good views and fairly good food, try Cafe Marly, in an open-air colonade near the Richilieu entrance. -Do try the private car tour recommended on the hotel web site. Really great and we thought it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights on a Reward Stay. We were treated very well. PROS: Great location close to 2 metro lines and the Arc. Modern hotel - hard to find in Paris Comfortable rooms Good bathrooms Great views from front rooms of the Arc Quiet rooms even though floor to ceiling windows in front Beds were very comfy Breakfast was good, not great Helpful front desk staff Rooms were good size for Europe CONS: Breakfast was good, not great

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great service”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: For a European hotel, the rooms are spacious and the beds are big and comfortable. The rooms are similar to US standards in terms of space. The concierge was so helpful and nice. I wouldn't pay for the breakfast unless you have a very early itinerary that day. There are so many cafes in the area you will find a nice breakfast somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mlnjordan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for five nights this month and I cannot say enough good things about the hotel. The room sizes (for Europe) are large and everything is impeccably clean and new. The bed was quite comfortable, with great linens and pillows, the bathroom large and although the roll-in shower was, to an American, odd (only half a door enables you to handily flood half the bathroom should you choose to do so) the water pressure was great. The room was SO quiet (facing the courtyard), who would think that in the middle of Paris you could sleep with your balcony door open and get a lovely breeze and have total quiet? The staff was great, the concierge quite helpful, and we felt welcomed by all. We were on our honeymoon and when we checked in there was an iced bottle of champagne, chocolates, and other gifts waiting for us compliments of the hotel. The location is ideal, as others have mentioned. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Great As Reviewed”
Reviews.Author: allenweiner
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Renaissance hotels I have stayed at in Europe (Amsterdam), this one is average at best. Great location, for sure, but for business travelers, there is no club room and the breakfast is just OK. The staff seems ambivalent at best and is very slow to refresh the food at the breakfast buffet. There is no coffee in the lobby prior to breakfast which seems to be common at other Marriotts. For the price (which is sky high), the stay was OK but nothing special. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: madamSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: I have heard horror stories about hotels in Paris however this hotel exceeded my expectations. The rooms are spacious and modern. We had a nice view from our bedroom. The only disappointment is that there is no separate shower in the bathroom. The shower head is located in the bathtub. The receptionists and concierge were very helpful. The location is great - right down the road from the Arc de Triomphe, and situated between 2 metros (Etoile and Ternes). Lovely cafes all around the hotel. All in all a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Buzzy1
Reviews.Content: As Marriott Platinum Elite, we were give top floor room with a patio and views of the Eiffel Tower & Arc De Triomphe (and also of the interiors of the apartments facing the hotel). Large room & bathroom, good bed, clean. Hotel staff is friendly & excellent. Good breakfast buffet. Great location with many nearby quality restaurants. Two metro stops close by. Five minute walk from the place where the Air France airport buses stop. No downsides to this hotel. Yes downsides to the value of the dollar to the Euro ($1.40-1) - lunches that are US$25 in States cost US$75 or more in Paris. So close your eyes to the dollar costs of everything.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, superior service”
Reviews.Author: sanjesh11
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its standards and promises. The staff is superb in taking care of hotel guests. We arrived early for our room, but were provided the room with a very short wait and the staff was very apologetic regarding the delay. The breakfast buffet was amazing with many choices for vegetarians. Anything we asked for was taken care of by the hotel staff with a smiling face. The location is great with local metro a few steps away.. so is arc de triomphe.. and champs elysses.. great restaurants where regular parisians dine and very economical too. overall, we including 2 boys 4,9 loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, BUT QUESTIONABLE CONCIERGE SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: Europeorbust786
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. THE ONLY BIG PROBLEM we had with this hotel was that they told us to buy tickets to Versailles from them to avoid waiting on line. Their tickets were 4 euros more, so we thought it would be worth it to avoid the long lines that are at every tourist spot. When we got their, we still had to wait on line for over an hour and a half. The concierge had told us that the tickets would get us into every section of Versailles, but when we tried to get into the gardens we were turned away due to the fact that our tickets were old. The had been purchased before high season and therefor we had to get back on a line and pay an additional fee to get into the gardens. When we got back to the hotel we expressed our disappointment and we were basically dismissed and told that the attendant at Versailles was only trying to take advantage of us because we were "tourists" even though everyone there is a tourist. The concierge told us he would look into it and then he never contacted us again was we actually didn't see him there for the next 2 days. I finally got a hold of a computer and sure enough the tickets that were sold to us by the concierge were old and were NOT the correct price. The hotel buys these tickets in bulk and they will go to any lengths to sell them to their guests even if they have to lie to them. Please BEWARE. Do not buy tickets from the concierge at this hotel. Since they even failed to contact us regarding the situation,we were left with a bad view of this hotel that would not and could not admit their mistake. They also kept our money with no explanation or apology. If anything they took advantage of us because we were "tourists."

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nameless64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance in mid April 2011. In many ways this is an excellent hotel, but there were a few demerits. Positives: location is a few short blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, close to two Metro stops, one of which is the Charles de Gaulle/Etoile stop that includes links to the RER system. It is a reasonable walk (ten or fifteen minutes) to the beautiful Parc Monceau, and just a few blocks from the Salle Pleyel, one of the major concert halls in Paris, where we saw a wonderful concert by the Orchestra of the Paris Opera. The staff was just about universally friendly and accommodating. In particular Cédric, one of the concierge staff, was quite helpful. Directions and suggestions were happily supplied, with copious google map printouts and highlighted routes and the like. The daily housekeeping service was efficient and timely. The place was spotless. When one night the promised turndown service never arrived, the next morning we had a personal note of apology from the manager, accompanied by a (quite good) bottle of wine and a small box of chocolates. The room was spacious and had a view overlooking the patio area outside the hotel restaurant. There was a small balcony with one chair, a table, and an ashtray. The soundproofing was excellent, and we were able to sleep in every morning without disturbance. The bed was very comfortable. Wifi worked well. The shower was poorly designed, but otherwise the bathroom was roomy, with good water pressure. Although we were using Marriott points to pay for the room, we were never treated as second-class citizens. We received the breakfast buffet for free, thanks to our Marriott platinum status. Negatives: It's a good thing the buffet was free, as it wasn't very good. The hot food was consistently cold, whether the items had been out there for a while or came straight from the kitchen. The fresh fruit was excellent. Often we would be finishing our breakfast before any staff came by to ask if we wanted coffee. I got the sense that the waitstaff didn't really know what to do with a buffet. Perhaps they are unusual in France? In any event, I would never have paid the (quite high) tariff they were demanding for this mediocre petit dejeuner. The following is a suspicion; I could be wrong. When the aforementioned Cédric wasn't at the concierge desk, I got the sense that the other concierges were directing us to restaurants with which the concierge had a prior relationship. i was twice told to give a particular place a try, and to "give them my card." I felt like I was being exploited somehow. Again, maybe I'm just paranoid, but it made me uneasy. I would definitely return to this hotel, but I think next time I would do more research on restaurants on my own beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming, helpful, modern hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mgregori
Reviews.Content: While our stay was quite short the experience was great. The hotel looks to be very new and is designed in a very modern style. The hotel staff were all very friendly and attentive. They also spoke excellent English which was a plus because we speak very little French. Before arriving we were sent an email confirming the arrival date, asking our arrival time and if there were any special requests. I replied with the details and made mention of our excitement to be celebrating our 15 anniversary as part of our stay in Paris. (more on this later in review). Our room was small (typical of a European hotel) but it felt very roomy and comfortable. The bed was VERY comfortable. The style again is very modern. The concierge was extremely polite and attentive and he provided us great recommendations on places to eat nearby, tour ideas and directions on how best to navigate the metro to get around the city. We felt the hotel location was great as it was just a few blocks from the arc de triomphe and a metro station. I can not comment on the food in the hotel as we always ate outside the hotel. A pleasant surprise for us is when we returned to our room from an evening of touring to find a bottle of champagne on ice, a candle and a small gift. We assume this is because we made mention of our anniversary in our confirmation email to them. We thought this was a nice touch which certainly was not expected or required. We would highly recommend this hotel if you are coming to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chaichaitea
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels that I have ever stayed at. The location was perfect, just a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. An airport bus is just a five minute walk away, and the surrounding area is full of wonderful cafes and shops. The staff was extremely friendly. The bed was very comfortable. The room was small and perfect, simply decorated and just lovely. My favorite part was that the outside wall was entirely large curved window, just perfect for looking across Paris in the evening! We were there to watch friends run in the Paris Marathon, and the hotel really made the runners welcome, including having a pre-run breakfast for them in the morning. I travel quite frequently and have stayed in many a Marriott. This one was hands down the nicest Marriott that I've ever stayed in. Perfect location, comfortable room, and friendly staff. What more could a traveler want?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly efficient service, pricy but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: djesler
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day trip with my wife and 12 year old son. We stayed in a junior suite which is basically a big room, but spacious enough for three. Very contemporary decor, great coffee machine, great shower. Our room had a tiny balcony but big enough for 2 to squeeze onto for a drink while watching the sun set over the rooftops. Our room was on the sixth floor and overlooked the courtyard. Staff were all very friendly. I cannot comment on the food as we ate out. Location was perfect for us. Within site of L'arc de Triomphe, a few minutes from the Air France shuttle bus stop (les cars Air France, great way to get there from airport no matter which airline), plenty of metro stops and restaurants nearby. Quite expensive, but hey, you're in Paris and it was good quality accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DNemo
Reviews.Content: This property has it all. Beautiful, spacious rooms located only three blocks from the Metro. The concierge was very friendly and made exceptional recommendations. Breakfast included a wide variety of options and was never crowded. I highly recommend this hotel and will return on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, big rooms, great beds, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a very comfortable, upscale experience at this newly built hotel which is a block north of the Arc de Triomphe (and the metro station there). It was one of our better stays in Paris and it didn't break the bank either. This hotel was just given a 5 star rating by the French hotel government rating system, but make no mistake, it's not like staying at the Ritz... more like staying at a new Westin or Hyatt. You could be in Paris or Atlanta after you walk in the door. The location is very convenient to public transportation... you can take the Air France bus (they're called "cars," which confused us after a 12 hour long flight) from CDG and get dropped off just a block away, across from the Arc. There are also two metro stations within two blocks... so if you don't mind going underground, you can get anywhere in the city easily. The immediate neighborhood is nice, middle/upper middle class residential, but not too fancy. There were one or two homeless men sleeping on the sidewalk on the same block as the hotel, but they did not bother anyone. It felt like a safe environment, even late at night.
