There are two categories of rooms... we stayed in both during our time at the hotel. There are rooms on the streetside with the spectacular curvy floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall windows... and the more conventional rooms on the courtyard in back, which have a small balcony and a chair (which I know some people would like). The rooms in back are cheaper and the courtyard in late winter/spring isn't all that attractive. Still, you can look over the rooftops if you get up to the fourth floor or higher. On the street side, you look through those undulating, quadruple-paned windows at the 6-story high block long french mansard-roofed residential blocks across the street (we could also see the very, very top of the Eiffel Tower if we craned our necks.) Those curving windows look fantastic in the daytime (and in the website photos taken at night), but we had to keep our curtain closed after dark... otherwise you are TOTALLY on display. That said, we'd still take them over the back rooms with the courtyard view. For Paris (and virtually anywhere else), the rooms in both categories are huge and tastefully decorated in a hip, not quite W hotel kind of way. We got a great night's sleep every night. The beds are really, really, really, really comfortable. Just as important, the street front rooms are soundproofed... and there are a lot of cars and busses passing in front of the hotel. The bathrooms are large and attractive... excellent water pressure in the shower and a cool Eiffel Tower art piece by the toilet (it's reflected in a mirror... you'll have to see it to understand). The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout our stay (except for the guys at the desk on the street who never said hello to us once... not sure if they were valets. It would help if they at least smiled at guests walking in... they didn't). There is a modern Moroccan-themed restaurant and bar in the hotel (an odd choice, I think) that was empty all day and faces the barren-in-winter courtyard. We never went inside. We had breakfast every day at a very nice McDonald's a block away, which offers free wifi on the ground floor). On the hotel website, a restaurant they recommend nearby is the Relais de l'Entrecote. It wasn't good... we've eaten at the one in Geneva which was far better. You might want to try Relais de Venise in Porte Maillot for the steak/frites experience. Now to the negatives. One big one. The hotel is built on top of two furniture stores. The lobby is located behind the stores and is small, long and narrow... as a result, it's no place you'd want to spend time or meet people. You have to walk alongside a furniture store display window to enter the hotel, as the lobby is set back from the street. The entrance looks tacky and made us enjoy our stay less, which is too bad, because the rest of the hotel is well-designed and the facade from the second floor up is very, very cool with all those curvy windows. Another negative... because of those huge windows on the streetside rooms, the a/c could not keep up on a warmish day. We'd return if we could get another good deal (we booked on the Marriott site). To be honest, we were expecting more of a luxe experience. We 'd give it 4.5 stars if we could. Since we can't, we'll give it 5 for the huge rooms, the comfy beds and for filling a niche... an upscale modern hotel for people who like to stay at upscale hotels but can't afford the insanely high prices of upscale hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMarco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, big rooms (difficoult to find in Paris) and close the tube. We reserved without breakfast (probably not so chip) but just outside there are many bakeries. Very close to Arch de triomphe and camps elisee, you can reach every attraction in Paris in a short time. I'll return in the next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: me78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location wise is perfect for the main roads to get to the fantastic views of Paris. Room was a great size with balcony (on 6th floor), clean, comfortable. Bar served good food and had a good,vibrant atmoshere. Would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Thorough and professional”
Reviews.Author: NW6mum
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our two night break here (me and two teenage kids). Service was friendly and helfpul, rooms and public spaces clean and well finished. Location fine for getting around central Paris as you are only a two minute walk from the tube station. If you're looking for straightforward and modern this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK hotel but not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: jknight910
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel, which included New Years Eve. The hotel was strictly OK. Not great but not bad. Certainly not 5 *. The hotel is way, way overrated. To add credibility to my review, please note that I stay over 250/nights per year in hotels. Please read any of my reviews. The good: 1) location is the best. Even better than the Marriott Champs-Elysees; 2) breakfast was included and was served until 11 AM; 3) staff very friendly and accommodating; 4) check-in was a breeze; 4) the hotel is very quiet. The not-so-good: 1) the price of the stay. I have the highest status at Marriott and used points for our stay. The hotel charged 140,000 points plus 90 EUR per night (this was not a problem. I knew this when I booked the room. But still, it’s the point of points + money); 2) the room was small (not a big deal but for 140,000 points and 90 EUR per night, I expected more); 3) breakfast. Yes, included and served until 11 AM. But, it was not good. Examples: consistently-everyday- cold (not cool—cold) food; one coffee maker for the entire restaurant. So, if you want a cup of coffee, you must wait in a line for your turn. If you want two cups of coffee –one for you and one for your friend—you wait in line for your turn and then hold up the line as you get your coffees; the lobby—what lobby--is nonexistent. Overall, just OK. But to put things in perspective. It was expensive for what you get. FYI: I have no problem buying an economy car. I just wouldn’t pay the Mercedes price for a Saturn vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence rarely seen at Marriott properties”
Reviews.Author: rmc1971
Reviews.Content: We arrived early; room was ready. We were celebrating two very special occasions; champagne arrived for both (no clue to either myself or my wife). Rooms were very quiet by Paris standards (and large as well!). The staff were amazing at answering questions, making recommendations and making us comfortable. Finally, our flight back to the U.S. was canceled at 4am, I called down figuring a huge bump in room rate, and they extended our room (and rate moreover) for the additional night without having to move rooms. I travel 60+ nights a year on business, and this trip just really reinvigorated me for the Marriott properties. Job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: nolag504
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and had a great stay. The staff was all very polite and helpful. The room was spacious and very clean. We received a little gift each day, a nice touch ( I actually brought them home with me). Everyone was professional and well trained. The location was great, and we could not have had a nicer stay, even the room service burger was good. The only complaint I have is that the WiFi is very expensive. Nevertheless, I would stay here again and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a clean, new hotel with US style amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: aysha087
Reviews.Content: Located few steps away from Arc de Triomphe this magnificient hotel offers a real 5 star accomodation in Paris center. We had room 206 with street view. Room was large, very clean and comfortable. Bathroom with bathtube, and shower so modern that it took some time untill I figured out how it works. We didnt ate at the hotel restaurant, so I cant say nothing about it, but the restaurants nearby have resonable prices and the food was good. I have nothing to complain about this hotel. The staff was very polite, they sent us a message showed on Tv display to apologise because during of one night the fire alarm started, even though we didnt hear nothing. I totally recommend this hotel, and I will come back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance made this one of the best travel experiences we ever had”
Reviews.Author: irene2850
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to go back. The staff could not do enough to make our stay perfect. Giving out advice, directions, umbrellas (which we needed almost every day), tips on shopping. Each room has a hot water pot, delicious teas, coffee and milk. The hotel met our every wish. The beds were great and the rooms had great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star- really a 3/4 star with bad service”
Reviews.Author: sarag7229
Reviews.Content: pros: good location nice bellmen nice staff in restaurant true king size bed Most of the cons come down to service. We were given a lower level room and it took multiple calls and visits to the front desk to straighten out the issue. Many calls again to have the crib we had asked for delivered. But the worst part of our stay was after we checked out and we came back to the hotel to collect our bags. our 8 month old had a terribly soiled diaper which we needed to change- the concierge told us there was no where we could go to change her and we needed a room. a 5 star hotel should help you find a quiet corner, bring you a towel if necessary, just be kind. This man was incredibly rude. It really changed our opinion of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: duchessjenjen
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very modern, clean. Room was nicely appointed & bed very comfortable. We had a courtyard facing room with a HUGE deck. Unfortunately, weather wasn't nice enough to enough the deck. My husband and i chose this hotel for location & availability of a multi-lingual concierage. The location was great - close to a metro stop & easy to get anywhere. However, we found that often the individuals manning the desk were not able to readily answer our questions (for example: we asked where a grocery/convenience store was & they had difficulties giving us directions). Also, we ordered room service one evening and staff seemed confused when we ordered & took quite awhile (maybe 45 minutes) for the coffees to arrive. Also, I had some issues with being able to post a couple postcards - was asked to come back the next morning. Overall, hotel was very nice, staff was attentive (even if they couldn't answer our questions - they found someone who could), and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect - Staff need help.”
Reviews.Author: Leese25
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to this hotel for a girl's shopping trip to Paris. I booked with Eurostar and emailed ahead to ensure our booking was correct. We arrived at night and I was a little disturbed by the thumping music from the restaurant as we arrived thinking we might not get any sleep. I was wrong, once in the lift, the sound disappeared. The hotel is modern and bright. A hotel choice for my daughter as she likes everything modern. Once at reception we were very well received and given a warm welcome. We were given a shopping package brochure which was free metro tickets and discounts, maps etc. A nice touch as I just booked the hotel with breakfast and was unaware of their packages. They swiped my credit card, gave me the room key and told us where the lifts were. The two lifts are very brightly coloured and very modern. We spent about 5 minutes pressing the button before going back to the reception to explain the lifts did not work. The receptionists looked very embarrassed as they had forgotten to tell us we had to use our room key in the lift as they had been programmed to only work with room keys to go up - a nice security touch - restaurant diners cannot get access to floors, but would have been more helpful to tell us about it. This was not a one off as we saw another couple having the same problem and another couple was joking with them that they had not been told either. Once is an error, three times is lacking. The room was bright, modern and light. Great flat screen tv and very comfy bed with bright white linen. The lounge chairs were better to look at than sit on, but not for my daughter who thought they were 'cool'. The bathroom was all dark slate and marble. Very very clean with no signs of wear whatsoever. The room was very quite. The windows being curved offered a great view. Breakfast would be my only real complaint. No-one was there to greet us or show us what was where etc. we came down at a reasonable time (9.40) and we felt a bit awkward as we did not know where to sit. After a couple of minutes we just sat down. I tracked down a waitress who made no attempt to explain how things went or where everything was. I had to ask for coffee but my daughter at that point was offered a hot chocolate. It all felt a bit awkward and I managed to source the cold buffet items. I had to again find a waitress as breakfast was included in my package and I did not know if that meant hot items (which were in an ajoining room, not with the main buffet items). I was then told that my breakfast was not included in the package. I tried to explain that it was and had been confirmed the night before. The waitress just stood and looked at me as if to say 'prove it'. So, in the middle of breakfast I had to queue in reception. The receptionist (obviously not the same one as last night) could not find where it was confirmed that breakfast was included and I had to ask if they wanted me to go to my room to get my papers down! I was told not to worry and they would look into it further. By this time I had gone off the idea of eating and just had my coffee, I had indigestion! The reception came back to me after 5 minutes and said she had made an error and that my breakfast was included. (so I did not have to feel like a thief after all!). My daughter had sat there for so long that she fancied something hot and when I asked another waitress if she could get a plate for her she asked me if I had paid for the breakfast!!! Not good customer service. Feeling like you have to prove yourself is not something I want to do. I always stay either 4 or 5 star when I go to Paris and staff should ooze confidence and be outgoing but discreet. Not shy and shouty! Apart from that, it was a pleasant stay, but staff need to be trained better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kwall1972
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. About a week out from our stay they emailed the confirmation, and throughout the rest of the week I emailed several questions and always got a very prompt response. I used Marriott points for the stay. We arrived at about 11:00 a.m. and were thrilled that the room was ready. It had two double beds as requested and the entire venue is non-smoking. We were able to take a bus from the airport that drops you off just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Also, the Metro was very close which we used daily to navigate through the city. Each night when we returned to our room, there was a small gift. The first day a bottle of wine, then a luggage tag, hand sanitizer, etc. What a pleasant surprise when you returned to your room after a long day. Every time you left or returned to the hotel the staff always had a warm welcome for you. The beds were very, very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious enough with great water pressure. And the hotel was very quiet the entire stay. From out room, I never heard noise from the hallway or the street below. We were on the sixth floor. We decided to eat in the restaurant the first night and the food was very good. And we had been emailed a coupon for a free bottle of wine which also was good. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Muneera
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris before several times, stayed in supposed to be first class hotels, but it seemed more like a bed and breakfast rather than real hotels. This hotel is the best in Paris, the location is good and The hotel amenities are wonderful, the only down side was the expensive wifi (other hotels offered free wifi) The rooms are somewhat expensive but it worth it. The rooms were excellent spacious with excellent bathrooms. The beds were comfortable and when my friend didn't feel comfortable with the type of pillows, they immediately changed them and she slept like a baby. The reception staff are excellent and the bell boys are THE BEST EVER. Chloe and Cedric the concierges were great as well, only one guy that I can't recall his name at the moment didn't give us the proper directions and when we got lost and l got back to him he responded in a truly stupid attitude that l have never seen, he has sub zero customer service manners. One more thing that kinda bothered me was the smell of the kitchen when you enter the hotel, although the staff were trying to mask it by burning incenses with pleasant fragrances. The girls says that they would never choose any other hotel when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “They are still the tops”
Reviews.Author: lovedisneyfam
Reviews.Content: After staying here last year, I was interested to see if it would be as good the second time around. It was even better. The room we had was incredible. I will say that the room was not breathtaking, but the view it had was! Being a Marriott Gold member, and after some tantrums with the front desk, Maryanne allowed us to choose either a Prestige room(much bigger) or room 804. Room 804 was about as big as the bed, but we had a balcony that I still have dreams of. The view/room was so incredible, that i gave up a free Champagne suite at another hotel and paid the Euro to remain at the Ren. If you are going to Paris, you simply must stay at the Ren ADT to enjoy what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: km121
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We chose a prestige room for the added space. This was definately its selling point. After reading so many reviews of other hotels and how small their rooms were we were more than pleased with our selection. The rooms are tastefully decorated with a modern clean feel. The staff were friendly and welcoming although im not sure the overall feel of the hotel is quite 5 star. Neverthless had a fantastic stay and would highly recommend it to anyone! I especially liked the small complimentary gifts that were left in our room, I thought this was a really great touch.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleased with my selection”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler90210
Reviews.Content: The bed was like sleeping in the clouds. This hotel is truely a hidden gem, very friendly staff. You can't can't go wrong with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic -- Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Marriott points on a planned stopover on our way to another location in France. We were upgraded (at a small cost) to a wonderful 2-room, high floor suite with double balcony overlooking the Arc de Triomphe. The room was very modern with a large, flat screen TV, mini-bar (ok prices) and a huge slate bathroom with separate shower and tub. At night, we could sit on the balcony and see the lights of Paris! Bed was comfy and room had every amenity (safe, bathrobes, etc.) that we could want. The hotel is less than 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe -- very close to the metro and quick connections throughout the city. It's very quiet at all hours. The hotel restaurant was nice -- good food and exceptional service. The hotel bar is a great place to relax at the end of the day. What absolutely made this hotel for us was the service. We were there during the national strikes (trains and other public transportation). The concierge alerted us to this situation and, when we realized we would have to significantly modify our travel plans, he went above and beyond to help us. We'd planned to say 36 hours and ended up staying for 4 days. First, he directed us to great tourist attractions and restaurants. When our plans abruptly changed, he found us a hotel in another country (which wasn't easy given that there was a major convention in town), booked our train (when it was almost impossible to get seats), delivered the tickets to our room, and made sure we spent the absolute minimum amount of time stressing about our travel plans so we could spend the maximum time enjoying Paris. He turned a terrible disappointment into a memorable experience. Everyone -- from the front desk to the waiters to the concierge -- were so friendly and helpful. Returning to the hotel each day was like coming home. They were wonderful. When we return to Paris, we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_Ma_48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday and I can only endorse the numerous positive comments about the overall experience. Its comfortable, stylish and in an excellent position but what really makes the difference here is the proactive and thoughtful service from the whole team (not always a given in Paris). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: DGA66
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way. Modern, immaculate and friendly. Mr. Alex Fitz, General Director was extremely thoughtful in providing my wife and myself a number of gifts in celebration of our 50th wedding anniversary. It was very kind of him to acknowledge this special event and we are grateful for his consideration. I also must compliment the RHI staff. Throughout our visit, we found everyone with whom we had contact to be pleasant, friendly and helpful. Whether it was the Security, restaurant manager and servers, bellmen or front desk personnel, everyone was unfailingly polite and eager to please. All of the Concierge staff were diligent in helping us with our requests, large or small. Of particular note, was the young lady who devoted considerable energy to making the last minute (and somewhat desperate) changes to our airline tickets. This is not to say that Xavier, Cedric and the other Concierge whose name I do not recall, were not enormously helpful in making our week-long visit special. They were equally attentive in every way and made our stay one of the most comfortable of our many trips abroad. My wife and I treasure "islands" of quiet in the midst of any great city and the RHI was that and more. We happily recommend this hotel to anyone who seeks a relaxing and pleasant hotel experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for attractions and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: SRQtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel since it was a great location and honored a Marriott friends and family rate. When I made the reservation on the Internet, I placed a request for 2 beds since I was traveling with another female friend. The site only showed a King room, but usually if you place a request in the comment section it is honored. Not so with this hotel. The clerk said all room with two beds were sold out. I highly doubted this since the hotel was far from full. the staff behaves as though they have a stick up their you-know-what. The room is extremely contemporary and if you didn't know you were in Paris, you wouldn't know it. The bathroom is ultra-modern. The shower has no raised rim and every time we took a shower, the water flowed into the bathroom area by the sink. The silicone gasket along the side against the sink counter was useless. The raised vessel sink was too tall for anyone under 5'5". I had to stand on my tip-toes and still got the front of me wet when using the sink to wash or brush teeth. The beds are fabulous and storage is most adequate. But...the worst is that one of the two elevators was not running. Upon the last day, we met another guest who had been there for 6 days. She said the elevators had been a problem since she checked in. The last afternoon, neither elevator was working and we had to trudge up the stairwell to our room. The staff either ignored the issue or didn't care. At no time did any staff member man the elevator explaining the problem. Did not try the restaurant or bar. There are too many fun, good cafe's close by. And there is shopping just around the corner. If you arrive by the Air France Shuttle Bus, it really is a short walk to the hotel. Don't take a cab unless you have lots of luggage. Our view was of the back overlooking apartments. Would have been nice to have the other side with a view of the Arc but there could have been road noise.

Reviews.Title: “It is magic! No, it is Paris.”
Reviews.Author: DMax2009
Reviews.Content: We were treated royally by the staff at this beautful hotel. Very attentive to our needs. We had an 18 month old traveling with us and they were always so sweet and attentive to him. The concierge, Xavier, is the utmost in professionalism, patience, charm and extremely knowledgeable. The location is within a couple blocks of the Arc de Triomphe and DeGaulle Metro station. Very convenient. Around the corner is a Monoprix (full service grocery, pharmacy, clothing, etc. store) They also have the best shampoo/conditioner in the guest rooms. Electrical adapter provided as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnski
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a mini suite. Points + $ Large room with proper furnishings. Great shower. Staff was very attentive. Answered all your questions and were very polite. One of the elevators was broken for most of our stay-When they fixed it the other one broke. But really not much of an issue. They took care of the problem as best they could. This was a great location. Two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. I might stay in another area of the city when we go back, but this hotel for this time was great.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: travellingpoodle
Reviews.Content: Here I go again, with my discerning palate for all things fabulous.. We stayed at this hotel in September and it was amazing, From first impression, when we were wisked into the hotel to the checkin area, we were introduced to Claire. She was professional, curteous, and made our stay, along with the rest of her colleagues, flawless. To add to the sweetness of the staff, we were offered lovely little nougat candies before we went up to our perfectly clean and appointed room. We went to Paris for our wedding anniversary, and I couldn't have imagined staying any where else in the city. When we returned from dinner the first night, we were delighted to find a lovely bottle of champagne alongside a box of chocolates, to help with the anniversary celebrations! They left nothing to be desired, everyone spoke French, English, and usually a third language which is convenient for travellers. Thank you Renaissance! You made our stay unforgettable, and now you will be the ONLY hotel we chose in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantasic Experience”
Reviews.Author: RASMAN
Reviews.Content: This is truly la creme de la creme. The Employees were wonderful and the rooms new and spotless. I would not hesitate to stay again. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly average - did not see the 5 star status”
Reviews.Author: FlynnboLondon
Reviews.Content: We did not book direct and this may have been why we were put in one of the few small rooms with no balcony (only noticed when looked at fire exits posters - 2nd day and so did not worry about requesting change) For Paris though the room was a reasonable size, clean. Everything else was "functional and clean" rather than spectacular. Staff friendly. Quiet of street noise for location. Very good location. Strange "air con" (outside of room) noise appeared for 20 minutes at 7am - which woke us both. Summary as per title - nothing majorly wrong but nothing to make it more than average - saw it as a 4 star and this makes value very neutral not 5 star little extras e.g. no slippers, robes, turndown services etc.

Reviews.Title: “UPSCALE, 5 STAR EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: danman7000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a word... fantastic. The staff is so responsive and helpful. It is what I expect a 5 star hotel to be. Perfection. Its location is great as well, and close to many of the places you'll want to visit. The concierge was very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about all of the things we were interested in. (and he can write upside down on your map!) While it is a bit pricey.... you get what you pay for and I will stay at this hotel any time I visit Paris in the future. Yes it was that good. If you can... grab a room on the top floor as we did. When we arrived we wanted to upgrade to a suite but none were available. We were glad we did not get it. Our room overlooked the Arc de triomphe and the Eiffel tower and it was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect welcome to Paris”
Reviews.Author: hotelietraveler
Reviews.Content: We felt right at home from the moment we arrived. From Heloise and Adrian at guest services, Alex the GM, to the very personable breakfast host/manager, the staff is exceptional. The location is convenient to Paris sights (L'Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees just outside the door), the metro, and some good restaurants. Rooms are comfortable, modern and well-appointed. The fitness center had everything we needed to keep to our workout routines. And upon departing, we felt we were saying goodbye to new friends.

Reviews.Title: “It's like sleeping in clouds”
Reviews.Author: ilir11
Reviews.Content: After scrounging together the last 35000 Marriott points to pay for this trip, I booked us our final night in Paris at the Reneissance, Arc de Triomphe, after staying four nights at a boutique hotel. We were blown away by the level of service, and the posh interior of the hotel. I mean the staff there has been trained to perfection, and they are polite to a fault. The rooms are so luxurious and spacious. Since space comes at such premium in Paris we were truly amazed. The room had a fridge, coffee and tea, and there is ice down the hallway. All the little details that you don't get in smaller hotels. The bathroom was spa-like. My wife said that the bed was so comfortable, that it felt "sleeping on the clouds". The location was perfect near Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees blvd. I know that this hotel is expensive, but if you have the money, it's a sure bet. You won't be disappointed. We were sad to leave this nice place behind and move on with our journey.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with excellent location, many nearby restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: FlyBonanza
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Hyatt Madeleine for four nights and coming back from Cannes and Montecarlo we stayed in the Renaissance for five nights. We were really pleased with the Hyatt and my expectations were high for this hotel. It did not disappoint. It is ideally located with many good restaurants and cafes around, plus the Champs Elysee two blocks away. The service is good, the rooms are clean and almost new.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, and Furnishings. It almost deserves a Five Star Rating.”
Reviews.Author: Arlington7175
Reviews.Content: This is a five star hotel on the French rating system, and I largely agree with what the reviewers have stated. The location is great. You are extremely close to two Metro stations which gives you flexibility for touring the city. Also, the room size is great for Americans who don't enjoy the "cramped charm" of most European hotels. Finally, the concierge was very helpful including arranging a car service. We would definitely choose to stay at this Marriott again. The furnishings, space, and convenience are all superior. However, as some of the other reviewers have correctly stated, this Marriott just falls short of its five star rating. T the staff are very courteous and many of them remembered our names during our stay. We also received a couple of nice welcome gifts in our room which added a very nice gesture. The hotel does continue to miss on a few little things. Sometimes the room would not be completely refreshed by forgetting the lotion, or restocking the coffee service. Some of the front desk staff while polite are not as intuitive as they could be or feel a little off at this price point/rating. While the staff are quick to respond, as another reviewer correctly put it, a five star hotel should only on the rarest of instances fail to meet perfection, even on the little things. We saw just a little too much reacting from both us and other guests, instead of just performing seamlessly. This should not be construed as a large criticism, but at this price point and rating, we hope within the next year, the hotel management works out the kinks so that the hotel can reach its maximum potential.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryDomRep
Reviews.Content: Jus one of the best Hoteles I have stayed in Paris, has the right location, only one block and a half from Arc de Triomph and therfore Champ Elysees, totally new building with big rooms, excellent service and breakfast !!!!!!!!!!!! Mainly all king bedded rooms , but has some superior with 2 double beds for families,

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annika59
Reviews.Content: Parisian hotels are well known to be terribly expensive, even when the location isn't particularly stellar. To treat ourselves, we swapped some Marriot Rewards Points for a stay at the Renaissance Arc De Triomphe and were not disappointed. The hotel is very conveniently located near the Avenue Wagram, 2 streets away from the famed Champs Elysees. It's about a 7-8 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe (and the Charles de Gaulle - Etoile station), and a 5 minute stroll to the Tertre station (which takes you direct to Gare Du Nord to catch the Eurostar). As you'll probably note from the reviews, the hotel is very hip and trendy, with a little ethnic Morrocan influence. There is a heavy use of dark coloured woods which make the hotel look quite sleek and sexy. Rooms are a good size, plenty of space to move around (and lay out your shopping, if you've done some damage!). The design in the toilet, in particular, the shower, is suspect, and quite often you might find yourself wetting the whole toilet floor while showering (there's no door to the shower, and and inadequate divider causes water to splash out). Service is as you would expect of a Renaissance / Marriott hotel, although we would give kudos to both the girl who checked us in (whose name unfortunately escapes us), and Dimitri at the concierge who went out of his way to assist us. The only drawback I would have in staying at this lovely hotel is the price - the room rate for the period we were planning to stay here was a whopping 379 Euros, which is probably way out of budget for most travellers like myself. Still, if you're looking for a nice splurge, this is a pretty good hotel to do it at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely New Hotel in Great Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: - Good location within walking distance to the Arc de Triumphe. - Rooms are adequate in size and bright; the beds are very comfortable. We had a room facing the garden area and it was very quiet and quite lovely. - Hotel staff service is good and they make every effort ensure your room is comfortable and meets your expectations. - Water pressure and temperature is good and the bathroom amenities are quite nice. - The air-conditioned rooms are always a welcome relief, particularly during the summer months when it can get a bit humid and warm in Paris. NEGATIVES: - Although lovely to look at, the ultra modern ambience and design of the space is not very functional. - Bathroom had only one sink and little counter space, so sharing was quite cramped. - There were some minor issues with room maintenance and elevator outages which surprised us for such a new hotel. However, I presume they are still working out the kinks. - The breakfast buffet is adequate, but very pricey if you don’t include it in the room price. The selection is somewhat limited and staff do not replace empty dishes frequently enough to keep a good supply in place. Staff also does not clear off your used tableware and they often fail to check to see if more coffee is desired. - Exorbitant prices for Wi-Fi Internet access. The Marriott-Renaissance brand really must come into the 21st Century and offer complimentary wireless services for all guests, especially at the room rates charged for these upper-end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We Had An Awesome Time at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kenaton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 10 days in June for sight seeing and cooking classes. We enjoyed staying here very much. The decor was outstanding. The service was good. The staff was very helpful to us. We got to know them pretty well over the course of our stay. The hotel was in a great location in terms of getting around Paris. The Metro was two blocks away, the champs elysee was four blocks away and the arc de triomphe was a couple blocks away also. We really liked the room we had (we were upgraded to a family size room) so we had plenty of room for our clothes and other items. The bathroom was large enough also. I was expecting smaller because everything is smaller in Europe. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended- a nice experience at a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a very nice hotel in an absolutely perfect location- steps from the Arc de Triomphe on a surprisingly quiet and charming spoke off the Place Charles de Gaulle/Place de l'Étoile. The resulting combination of convenience and quiet can't be beat. The hotel itself has much to recommend it, but in my opinion falls just short of deserving a 5-star review. The rooms are nice, if not spectacular; the balconies are a lovely touch, although as others have noted, they are small and, in some cases (mine included), look over an interior courtyard with no view beyond. They checked me in immediately despite my *very* early morning arrival, which was greatly appreciated- they would have been justified in charging me for the room for my check-in night but did not. I admit that I was a bit disappointed that they weren't able to fulfill my request for a high room with a view. I did experience one major (to me, at least) service problem, which unfortunately happened two nights in a row. Having made coffee in the room in the afternoon on my first day, I asked the front desk to have my room refreshed in the evening. It wasn't until the next morning, as I prepared for a meeting, that I realized that they had totally ignored the coffee service. I mentioned this unpleasant surprise to the front desk and was offered a quick espresso to go, which was appreciated. That evening, I once again asked for a refresh, specifically mentioning the coffee service. I returned to find that the coffee service had been ignored once again. I informed the front desk and received a polite, if tepid, apology- certainly not the level of reaction I'd expect at a 5-star hotel that made the same service mistake two days in a row. I was as upset by the blase reaction as I was by the service screw-up and asked for a manager, who did respond in a 5-star manner by apologizing sincerely, empathizing with my annoyance, and scheduling a free breakfast delivery for me in the morning. The gym is nice and has free drinks. The lack of free wifi, however, is a real negative- when your 5-star competitors such as the Hotel de Crillon (not known for giving out freebies) are offering complementary wifi, it's time to get in board and drop the outrageous daily/hourly fees for the service. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Renaissance as a pleasant and comfortably place to stay, especially if they work out the kinks in their service and drop the silly wifi charges.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Naruto7860
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a 3 night stay last week at this 5 star abode. Managed to get 2 rooms at a discount rate of 398 Euros which is not bad for peak time of year. I traveled with my parents (in there 60's and 70s) and my niece (teen) The hotel is chic, modern, with all the amenities you would expect. The staff were very attentive to detail and had in advance of my stay helped booked restaurants that I could not contact. Concierge service is fantastic!. Breakfast was pricy (24-28Euros) but service great. Did not have an evening meal there. Stone throw away for Arc de Triomphe and beautiful sidewalk cafe scene. Metro only 5 min walk with Charles de Gaule -Etoile station that takes you direct to all key sights (Louvre, Bastille,Trocadero etc) I have a global business traveler and have to say I was very impressed with this stay in Paris. Only downside (and its not really the hotels issue) is getting a cab is a nightmare in Paris. The bellhop was fantastic at running to get cabs which for some reason dont easily swing by the front of the hotel which is on Ave de Wagram Will be back there with my wife in December!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!! Attentive staff and beautiful views of the Arc and Eiffel at night”
Reviews.Author: epicentre666
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel exceeded expectations, both in terms of the room and guest services. We had initially booked a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, so we were most excited to be upgraded to the 'suite' with the same view. We really appreciated the effort made to accomodate us that early in the morning (not to mention the complimentary breakfast while we waited). The front desk was polite, charming and extremely attentive to our needs. For that matter so was everyone else we interacted with including the concierge and bellhop. The suite was quiet, spacious with a comfortable bed. Room service was quick and the food from the downstairs Makassar Restaurant was delicious. This hotel made our first night in Paris very romantic and special. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Considering”
Reviews.Author: NativeNewYorker97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of a busy city block, and upon arrival there was a gentleman standing outside the hotel who appeared to be security, but who was not particularly welcoming or helpful. Once my husband and I entered the building there were three independent desks each with hotel representatives. The woman at the first desk did not acknowledge us at all when we walked in, but continued what she was doing. The woman at the second desk greeted us warmly and began the check-in process (it was at that time when a young man approached us and asked if we needed help with our luggage). After what seemed to be a somewhat involved check-in process, we were given the key cards to our room. I don’t remember the hotel representative telling us this, but the key is also used in the elevator prior to your floor selection (some people did not appear to know this and, throughout our stay, we frequently saw people struggling with the elevator). Although the desks in the reception area do not have signs, it appears that the first desk that guests encounter is that of the concierge staff. The concierge staff is very helpful, but it seems counterintuitive to have them as the first desk that guests encounter since the concierge staff does not assist with check-in or acknowledge guests if they are preoccupied with other tasks. However, when we did use the concierge staff they were efficient and helpful. From the hotel’s website, we knew the hotel was new with an ultra modern decor. Overall, the suite we were assigned was well appointed, although equivalent in size to a large US room, rather than a suite. We requested a suite with a balcony – what we did not know was that (a) the balcony overlooked the interior courtyard of the hotel (i.e. no view), and (b) there was only one chair placed on the very narrow, tiny, triangular balcony. Lucky for us we spent very little time in the room. It appears that because we booked a suite and/or because of my husband’s Marriott status, a bottle of champagne was brought to our room after we arrived...this was a nice touch. On the last day, my husband found an electrical adaptor hidden on a shelf that the hotel appeared to provide for guests to use throughout their stay (another nice touch); however, that was never told to us (but since we travel with our own international adaptors this did not matter much to us, but could matter to others who may be in need of an adaptor). The bathroom was also very modern. We only had a small shower, but the large rain head was quite wonderful (and there was also a handheld shower head). In general the staff did a good job, but one evening before we left for dinner my husband called to have our room serviced. When we returned the room had not been serviced and we did not have clean towels for our morning shower. We had to call at 1 am and wait for someone to bring us towels. As for the doormen, they try to be very attentive, but it is quite likely that at any given moment you may not see any of them at the front of the hotel for a variety of reasons. One of the major reasons is that in Paris, they have taxi stands. If you ask a doorman for a taxi, he has to run to the taxi stand, wait for a taxi and ride back to the hotel. In addition, when a taxi is hailed for you either by your doorman or called for you (by the hotel or a restaurant), you are required to pay the fare from where the taxi originated as well as the fare to your destination. So it is a benefit that the hotel is conveniently located near two metro stops, one of which is a major connector to several lines. And there are two taxi stands near the hotel where guests can go and hail their own taxi. The staff tries to be very helpful and speaks fluent English which is great for those of us who speak little or no French. The hotel is conveniently located near transportation and has clean, well-appointed, nice-sized rooms. Although there may be a few kinks, the hotel is worth considering while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel, but as you stay there – you get the negative impression .....”
Reviews.Author: bquiet
Reviews.Content: Low Floor Inside view King (we used our Marriott Reward points) [ My scale: failure – below average – average – above average – the best ] About me - 6ft, 270lb Texan that travels much of the time and all over the world } Bottom Line – This is a very nice hotel, but as you stay there – you get the impression that mgmt is not really driving a sense of “doing it right all the time as the norm” – things start to get missed or are wrong – and they do try to make it right when you call – but for a 5 star – they should have this process down cold – and things should just be right all the time as a norm – with only the rare exception – not – “oh we are sorry we will fix that now.” } First Impression from the outside – [above average – best] – for a hotel in the city – this place is just 1 year old – and the street arrival view is very nice } First Impression of the lobby – [above average] – it is very nice, well decorated } First Impression of the room – [average] – it is what you expect from a 5 star. A clean/modern design and furnishings. Big bed (a real king size in Europe). A small balcony via a large wall of glass and sliding glass door. (not sure all rooms have a balcony) } Room – The Bathroom – [average] – it is what you expect at this level. Medium sized. It has the half glass panel used as a shower curtain (very common in Europe hotels of this level) Note – the step down out of the shower/tub is a long way down. There is a handle to grab, but it is a long way. } Room – The Bed – [above average – best] – my wife really really liked this bed. I thought it was very good. } Noise – [above average] – it was good – some noise from adjacent rooms – and only noise from the hallway if someone was right outside the door. } Heat/Cool – [below average] – it was a +/- dial for a central type AC. It was actually cold in Paris during our stay, and there did not seem to be a way to warm up the room at night. } Service – Housekeeping – [below average] – they completely missed cleaning the bar/coffee area one day. So when we got back to the hotel, we had to call. They sent up a person (not the usually housekeeping people) and they cleaned it. But it course, this is while we were in the room in the evening getting ready for other things. Not sure how a 5 star does not have a process in place to check each room after cleaning (to avoid this type of error). } Service – Front desk and Concierge – [below average] – which is not good at this level of hotel. You are paying for this service. One Concierge (Xaiver) is very good. One concierge either did not understand or just gave us wrong information on when the Louvre is open. (2 data points there – when they stop selling tickets, and the time they actually close the galleries (kick you out)) At checkout – they hit me with all these bogus charges – mini bar (no sorry did not use it). $15 for a collect phone call using their collect service/instructions printed on the phone. (no sorry – not for a collect call) I had these removed, but it took the girl some time and talking with another girl to do this. The baggage check service is very good. } Service – Food [average] – we can only speak to our complimentary breakfast (which does not come with every reservation). The selection is good, although you have to know there is more/warm food behind the bar. No one really tells you anything, and it is not intuitive that you should go look there. } Service – overall attitude from mgmt through to the staff – [below average] – which for a 5 star is really a fail. They have been open a year now. They should have this down cold. This is a general sense of “oops, sorry we will fix that”. Some individual people do go the extra mile to help you – but the mgmt at this place really needs to change the mindset to – “we do it right all the time, and any error is a big issue – that we will fix for the customer right away – & then make sure our process does not allow that to happen again.” } Little Extras ) not really – everything costs ) you do get the keep the card holder they give you (might be leather) } Other Notes ) They have a 2 PCs in the business center – but it is 10 euro for 45min (they use IBahn) – rather expensive. Would I stay there again? – Not likely - at the regular/normal prices Would I recommend this place to a friend? – Not likely – maybe for business

Reviews.Title: “great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: SFO_traveler001
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Paris! The rooms are larger than your typical small Parisian hotel room. The hotel is fairly new, so the rooms are modern decor. Some may not like the colder modern decor rather than the more traditional decor. I prefer it because it seems much cleaner. We had a room overlooking the street and you could only hear the street noise in the morning as the trucks drove by. Justin Bieber stayed there during our stay and we heard the crowd of the teeny-boppers singing and yelling his name. It was more fun than an annoyance. The staff were very attentive and helpful. The concierge was one of the best that I have dealt with (can't remember his name, but he writes amazingly well upside down and if you make a comment to that, he'll have you write your name upside down and put it in his collection book). The hotel is close to the metro and conveniently located near the Air France airport bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TheSnus
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 yr old son and I stayed one night at this hotel and it was exactly what you would expect from the reviews and star rating. It's beautiful - contemporary, high quality, excellent staff, breakfast buffet was expansive for Europe and location is excellent. The beds were super comfortable, the room was large compared to other hotels, the decorating is super contemporary, it's quiet, especially compared to other Paris hotels and the amenities plentiful and high quality. We went out for dinner and when we returned, they had replaced all the towels, used coffee cups, emptied all the trashes and left chocolate on the pillow. Only downfall is that it's extremely expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious Indonesian Restaurant & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way in comparison to other Marriott managed properties in Paris. The service is really good; very friendly to non-French speakers. The rooms are lovely, quiet & comfortable. The very best part was the delicious Indonesian restaurant on site. It was sublime & the manager (Frederick?) was charming & hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service,facility and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MPGDAWG
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the reniassance and the accommodations were outstanding! The staff was very friendly and professional. Our concierge Dimitri was the best we've ever encountered. We gave him an advanced proposed agenda and he booked all our tours.We got outstanding reservations at local restaurants and his ideas for additional sights were excellent. You walk out your front door and the Arc de Triomphe is 3 blocks away.Our room was comfortable and had a great terrace overlooking the rooftops of Paris. We were celebrating our 41st wedding anniversary and everyone at the hotel made it one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “We Would Stay Here Again in a Heartbeat -- Great Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ATP1
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with this hotel for many reasons. Yes, it's a bit on the modern/minimal style, which generally does not appeal to us, but everything else about this hotel made me forget that. Where to start? Checking in was a breeze. The hotel staff here is unbelieveably friendly, from the front desk to the concierge. I could not believe we were in Paris! The only issue I had was getting the attention of the bartender one afternoon. My husband claims this was a cultural issue, but I felt it was annoying. But Carlos came to save the day and made sure we were taken care of. Our hotel room was far bigger than we expected. It had a little balcony, which was a nice surprise. It overlooked a small garden area (rather than Wagram Ave.), which made it very quiet at night. We also saw some amazing sunsets from that balcony, which I never anticipated. A nice bonus. The room was also very clean, and the bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was very modern and clean. Absolutely no complaints. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, which we really enjoyed. Some might find this area to be too "touristy", but we really enjoyed it. It is also located very close to a Metro station. We ate at several restaurants in the area -- some recommended on the hotel's website -- and enjoyed each one. This hotel was a major reason why we enjoyed our stay in Paris so much.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Honeybee2121
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was charming and friendly, and the service was excellent. My room was clean and large, and I got a complimentary upgrade to the executive floor (Merci, guys). Everyone spoke English, which was helpful for me as a non-French speaker. My room was big, with a very comfortable bed and immaculately clean. The bathroom had a great shower and plentiful hot water. The hotel is very modern, in a Modern glass building with contemporary decor in the rooms. Some people might not like that, given that it is Paris and perhaps would want something a little more charming. Also, the modern design is now somewhat out of date - and would have been very chic in 1994. This hotel is also a Marriott (under their Renaissance label which competes with Starwood's W hotels). Like other Marriots, you have to be careful not to sneeze the wrong way or they will charge you for it. I asked them to get me a car to the airport and said a shared van would be fine. They tried to talk me into a 280 Euro private van (I booked the Paris Airport Shuttle online for 20 Euro). WiFi is not free and costs an arm and a leg. There are no vending machines, just very expensive minibar items. So, be prepared for that. The location is wonderful, right near the Ar de Triomphe and Champs de Elyees and very walkable to all the great sights of Paris. It's also surrounded by good restaurants and cafes in a multitude of price ranges. Overall, however, I think there are better bargains and more interesting places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Clemsongal42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April. The rooms are very comfortable, the bathrooms are beautiful. The staff was very helpful and went above and beyond. The hotel is an easy walk to the metro which makes getting around Paris very easy from the location. It is also an easy walk over to some of the best shops on Champ d'Elysees. The fitness center was great. The only thing I can say is if you are looking for a traditional Parisian experience then you may want to try another hotel, this hotel gets most of it's influence from Bali.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Experience an icing on cake”
Reviews.Author: HimanshuJ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located at just a walking distance from Arc De Triomphe and the main Champ De Ellyses market and Metro Station. The rooms are quite different from any normal hotel, in the sense that they are designed beautifully into unique shapes rather than the usual rectangular cut. The staff is courteous and food good. Being centrally located means you can go out anytime and enjoy a late night dinner at Champ De Ellyses and then walk back to the hotel. Overall an excellent choice to make your Paris stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty incredible hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: I concur with all of the most recent reviews that this is most probably the best Marriott property in Paris. Now, I admit to using Marriott points for the visit, so there was no actual outlay of cash. But still, by any comparison, this was a great experience from the time we arrived until we left after 5 nights. We were totally taken care of. Staff couldn't have been more pleasant and accomodating. They got us dinner reservations, they directed me to the nearest "laverie" (only 3 blocks away) so that I could self-serve wash my laundry quite efficiently (instead of paying truly incredibly high rates for the hotel to do my laundry, which is typical of Paris hotels), and provided accurate directions to so many other places. Whenever we arrived or departed, we were greeted with smiles, doors were literally opened for us always, etc. etc. As a Marriott Platinum member, I recieved arrival bonus points AND the hotel manager sent up a bottle of delicious French wine as well. I was given complimentary full American buffet breakfast for 2 every day AND free in-room Internet access. Even though we arrived at 11 a.m., at least two hours earlier than I anticipated, they found a great room for us to check in early. I wouldn't hesitate to come back to this Renaissance property again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but standards and service were very hit and miss. Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TheHotelInspector1
Reviews.Content: Having visited Paris on many occasions, I have always been underwhelmed with the standards and levels of service at the many Hotels I have stayed at so with this in mind, I decided to splash out a little and stay at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor and other reviews, I felt sure that my expectations would be met and exceeded - sadly this was not the case and I was really disappointed at my overall experience which was barely satisfactory. When I booked the three night stay via the marriott website, I took advantage of a promotion which equated to the third night being free if paying with Visa. The standard room rate was 299euros per night and with the promotion, it equated to 200 euros a night which I felt for the location alone was well worth it. Having booked the hotel, I did not receive an email confirmation so had to email Marriott customer services to check that there had been no problems with the booking. This request was dealt with really efficiently, the booking confirmed and I was advised that the Hotel would email me also to confirm the reservation. This confirmation never came which was disappointing. I was emailed by the Hotel however a week before my arrival to ascertain what time I would be arriving and also asked did I have any other requests. I emailed the Hotel back and stated that I would be arriving mid-morning and an early check-in would be appreciated. I also asked whether I could be allocated a high floor room overlooking the Avenue de Wagram which I noticed was not an option when booking due to taking advantage of the promotion. I was emailed back very efficiently stating that my requests had been noted. I was really impressed with this and appreciated the gesture. I arrived at the Hotel about 11am and after eventually getting a porter to park my car ("complimentary") in the 35euros a day hotel car park, I proceeded into the reception area. I was dealt with more or less straight away by a very friendly, polite and courteous receptionist. She advised me that the request for a high floor and "upgrade" had been noted but sadly that the room was not yet ready and to come back between 1 and 2pm. Whilst this was a little disappointing, I fully appreciated that if a guest only checks out at 12 noon then requests for early check-ins cannot be guaranteed. As a result we went on an open top bus tour of Paris and arrived back at the Hotel at 2.30pm. When I approached the receptionist she looked shocked and said "Oh, you are back..." and then told me the room was still not ready. I was really unhappy with this and the receptionist invited us to the bar for a complimentary drink. This in itself was a nice gesture I suppose but waiting 20 minutes to be served two small beers that we had ordered via her was really annoying. The bar had one other customer in it at the time and the bar tender spent 15 minutes preening himself in the mirror and then took a further 5 minutes to pull 2 small draught beers - an absolute joke. We had one sip and were then advised that the room was now ready so we had in effect been allocated a room 5 minutes before the regular check-in time - great! I was really pleased however that we had been allocated a room on the 6th floor overlooking the avenue de wagram at no extra charge so this made up for the poor start. Whilst the room was modern and nicely furnished, I thought it was on the small side. It was well equipped however with mini bar; snack basket; tea/coffee machine;safe; flatscreen tv; pay per view movies; iron/ironing board. The bathroom also was modern with a hairdryer; toiletries and the standard dressing gown and slippers. I was disappointed that there was no bath. The room was clean although very dusty and the carpet looked quite worn/stained. A few moments after arrival in the room, a complimentary bottle of water and some chocolates were delivered along with a welcome letter - another nice touch! However, the following things relating to the room were very annoying and just not acceptable with a complete lack of attention to detail: 1) Shower controls did not work. The pressure was so poor that if you tried to transfer the water flow from the shower head to the overhead shower, you had to hold the button in the whole time with one hand and wash with the other hand 2) The shower screen which separates the shower from the sink is far too small so the bathroom gets totally flooded when you shower. This is not made any easier when you are trying to hold the button in and wash yourself at the same time! 3) On arrival there was a selection of coffee/tea/milk on offer. However, every time the room was made up they were never replaced so a call had to be made to Housekeeping every day to get them replaced. Even the mugs and cups were never replaced - simply taken away. The first day we asked it took an hour and even then we had to request it twice. On the second day we went down to reception to mention that we again had no tea/coffee/milk/mugs and the guy at reception looked at us like we had grown two heads! An hour later they were delivered to the room. 4) The mini-bar/snack tray was never re-filled throughout the whole stay - just not good enough! 5) The drinking glasses in the room were both badly chipped - luckily I noticed this before I cut my lips open! We did get them replaced but the chipped ones were back the following day 6)The air conditioning was very loud and totally ineffective so I can only presume that the Hotel can over-ride the in-room setting to save money. 7) There was no "Do not Disturb" sign within the room and despite asking for one this never was provided. As a result, we were constantly interupted day and night!! We ate at the Makassar restaurant once and I must say that this was a real redeeming feature of the Hotel. We did book a table (following 3 attempts to get through to reception) and I was surprised that the restaurant was more or less devoid of customers so it did lack atmosphere. We did wait at the restaurant entrance for 5 minutes before anyone noticed us which again is not good enough! The meal however was excellent and the young lady who served us was superb. She was very attentive, courteous and polite and really made the whole dining experience one to remember! I believe her name was Fanny and she deserves sincere praise for her professionalism and dedication to providing the very highest levels of service. The only downside to the meal was that the cocktail we ordered - a mojito, was not available due to the bar having no mint!! The bar seems to promote its cocktail menu yet doesnt have the basic ingredients to provide them. I heard a number of people order a mojito whilst I was having drinks in the bar and they all appeared equally disappointed that they were unavailable due to lack of a basic ingredient! My only other criticism of the Hotel relates to the lift! The lift appeared to have a mind of its own. The lift could only be opearted by first inserting the room key card which I appreciate is a good security measure but whatever button you pressed you could be going up and down in the lift for ages before the floor you selected was ever reached! The same applied when waiting for a lift - not only did it take ages but when you did get in after selecting the lift down option you ended up going up!? Exsaperating and so annoying! On our final day, we did have room service - namely a continental breakfast and an american breakfast and whilst pricey, was excellent and delivered as ordered. Sadly there was no milk with the coffee (sound familiar..?) We wished we had taken a room service breakfast every day as it was lovely - freshly prepared croissants and danish pastries along with a piping hot well cooked breakfast. Again, I cannot fault the catering at this Hotel, it is first class!! The check out process was really really efficient and the receptionist was lovely - a fine ambassador for the Hotel. The car was brought round by the very helpful and dedicated concierge and the bags were packed in the car by the highly efficient porters. I think on balance I would recommend this Hotel but give realistic expectations. I am sure that you could find a lot better for your money although Paris does appear to suffer from really poor customer service and a complete lack of attention to detail. This Hotel asks you to contact DTS whenever you need anything which equates apparently to Delighted to Serve - from my experience it really means Dedicated to Suffering!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great pace to stay. I liked it”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arc De Triomphe opened in May 2009. It is in a fabulous location near (as the name says!) to the Arc De Triomphe, and so is very central and accessible to all the central attarctions. It is also very stylish and impressive from a decor point of view. Most of the hotel as a real "wow" factor. The lobby is bold and dramatic. The bar just off the lobby very trendy, and the restaurant is as well. The rooms are large for Paris, with striking floor to ceiling windows, large comfortable beds and small but perfectly suitable desk for working. There is a large flat screen TV with a lot of channels in varying languages. Overall they are bright and comfortable. The hotel is fairly expensive due to the location and the overall offering. The meeting rooms are large and bright, with patios outside that would be great in the summer. Overall a great hotel. Liked it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, location, and service.”
Reviews.Author: cheohee
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week after the hotel opened, so they were still under construction. The room was one of the best during that trip. Very comfortable, and HUGE by Paris standards. The only real coomplaint was the shower, which sprayed water all over the bathroom. This hotel is very modern, so it isn't the place if you're looking for old-style French charm. However, the location cannot be beat. The hotel restaurant is over-priced, as are almost all the eateries near the Arc de Triumph. Go towards the Ave. Wegman Metro station for better selection and price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Modern European Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Thadorian
Reviews.Content: I can't even think of a flaw to talk about with this hotel. Everything from the staff, to the rooms, and the location were second to none. The hotel is surrounded by countless small bakeries and different cafes that are great for a morning meal. The hotel was built so very recently that everything was in perfect working condition in the room. The RER is very close to the hotel, and was how we traveled in and out of Paris. Paris is larger than some of the touristy cities, and you will need to take the metro or a taxi to get around. Keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - cannot fault it”
Reviews.Author: accidentprone
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary and we had a superb stay. We received a very walm welcome from all the staff and they had upgraded our room and given us a bottle of champagne to celebrate too. The room was immaculate, we are very fussy and quite often have to change our room on arrival if its not clean or as advertised. We were satisfied in every way, the bathroom was lovely and the bed was so comfortable, we heard no traffic noise at all and it is a fairly busy street outside, and also had a view of half of the Eiffel Tower too! The tea/coffee making facilities were also very useful in the room. All the staff were very friendly, nothing was too much trouble, not that we needed to complain about anything. We did not eat at all in the hotel restaurants as it appeared quite expensive but there are numerous restaurants very close by. The hotel also has a small gym which we didn't get time to use but it looked well equipped. We would highly recommend this hotel as we found it faultless. The location is also great within a short walking distance of the Arc De Triomphe and about a half hour walk to the Eiffel Tower. Thank you for an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing anniversary present - surprised it's only 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Gomez90
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for our 2yr anniversary as a surprise and I can honestly say that I could not have chosen a better place myself! The staff and service were excellent, I felt like a VIP and that we were the only people at the hotel. Whatever we wanted, we got it and it didn't matter how trivial it was or at what time, because the hotel concierge was there at hand to help us out. The hotel rooms were quite large for European standards and the hotel interior and exterior were very modern and sophisticated in design, but at the same time, warm and cosy. The room was very comfortable and clean, as well as being clean throughout the hotel. The restaurant and bar have a warm and friendly atmosphere as well as being able to cater for you if you're feeling romantic. There is a choice between an Indonesian and French menu which are very authentic but also able to cater for those not willing to be adventurous. Great city, fantastic location and idyllic hotel - a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ooh La La! Would definitely recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: xxmxx
Reviews.Content: Situated a stones throw away from one of Paris's tourist hot spots, this hotel was better than expected. We had heard that the French do not have a knack for service however the staff at this hotel prove everyone wrong. They were very friendly, professional and attentive. The hotel itself has a wonderful modern feel to it and the prestige rooms are spacious, well decorated, very clean and cozy. It worked out to be very good value with our Marriott reward points. We definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “hip, nice, good location, but no "ahhs"”
Reviews.Author: eab0895
Reviews.Content: Great Location, funky architecture and nice views from the rooms facing the street. The staff was very friendly, the location was only feet from the Arc and the Champs’ Elyse, Very modern, vibe. Definitely a trendy and hip hotel, so probably not best with kids. When I went in October 2009, the hotel had just opened and the in-house restaurant and bar were not quite up and running yet. The room was modern and very cool and probably a little above average for Paris, which is not saying much. You could probably do better for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Marriott Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: phennisbaby
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to every continent with the exception of Antarctica at least once for business and/or leisure. Yes, I have learned and used many of the polite phrases and greeting in the language of the countries to which I have traveled. Since I am only fluent in English, I have at times experienced challenges in attempting to have my disappointment addressed by hotel staff regarding the accommodations I have been assigned during my years of travel. Therefore, whenever feasible and possible, given the purpose of my travel, I take accommodations at a Marriott or Renaissance. Why? Because 99% of the time: the staff members of that Brand treat me respectfully; my accommodations have been exceptional...spacious rooms, ultra comfortable beds; the room rates do not break the bank; food and service are exceptional; and the facility locations have met my needs. I have been to Paris several times and will be there again in late May and in June 2010 for business (and hopefully a little leisure). I have already made reservations at the Renaissance Hotel Arc De Triomphe and at the Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel and Conference Center. Even though I have never stayed at those facilities during previous visits to Paris, I am confident that I will be given great rooms, have options for wonderful food choices at reasonable prices, and will have an enjoyable and successful trip. I Trust and Love the Marriott/Renaissance Brand...Because its staff members act in ways that cause me to feel: welcome...as if I have been expected and they are pleased at my arrival; and my comfort and satisfaction are important to the Brand and them! I feel respected at Marriott/ Renaissance facilities! DWBrookins A Loyal Marriott Award Member

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: sar109
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely professional and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: SachaM3
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here for Christmas and we had a fantastic time, the hotel was pretty funky for a Marriott as it only opened in 2008 I think. The windows were well insulated against sound, the bathrooms were beautiful as were the shampoos etc they leave for you. We only ate breakfast which was great but cant comment on the rest of the food. One of the best things about this hotel was how well located it was, you could walk anywhere or get the tube with ease as its right on top of one of the major tube stations with many lines passing through. We nearly stayed in the Champs Elysee Marriott but chose this hotel for the funky interior which was definitely the right choice. The Champs Elysee was too busy all the time and given that this was only around the corner, we didnt miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, gracious staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddy007a
Reviews.Content: The concierge staff was superb and graciously led us to new and wonderful dining experiences. We greatly appreciated being able to check in early the morning of our arrival. That great courtesy allowed us to maximally enjoy our first day in Paris with 2 teenagers – first time visitors to Paris. The entire staff was most attentive and made us feel welcome – greeting us by name at every encounter and remembering what we liked for breakfast was truly amazing. The welcome gifts were a nice touch as well. The location is perfect for walking or a trip on the metro to various destinations around Paris. In short, the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe provided the best accommodation we have ever experienced in our many travels to Paris over the past 10 years. We look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: RJMGreenwich
Reviews.Content: This newly renovated hotel is outstanding. Service exceeded expectations. Was greeted each time by the staff by name. Great location, many shops and dining spots are close by foot and close to public transportation. I can't wait to return in the future, this will be the only hotel I will stay at in Paris. Spent five nights with my two siblings and we could not have been more happy.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: ShariNyc_Ny
Reviews.Content: This brand new Renaissance hotel lived up to all my expectations and way beyond! My husband and I just returned from a 4 day anniversary celebration. Prior to our arrival, the concierge desk had e-mailed me asking if there was anything they could do. They booked a day trip for us from Paris to Reims and Epernay, the champagne capital, and the guide/driver they chose was perfect. It was a 45 minute ride from the hotel and a trip we won't soon forget. We got a private tour and tasting of some smaller and some well known champagne houses. So kudos to the fabulous concierges: Dimitri, Mikael, and Xavier. They also provided us with the right restaruants to go out to for dinner. The room was amazing- we booked using Marriott points, and paid to upgrade to a business room, but the hotel upgraded us to the highest floor with a balcony and view of Paris.
