This hotel is in a perfect location, just steps from the Arc de Triomphe, and less than 5 minutes to the Champs Elysee. We even walked to the Louve and Museum D'Orsay- took about 25 minutes. I would gladly stay there again, as the staff was the most friendly of any hotel i have ever been in my 5 trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It made our trip more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: lovedisneyfam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was new and very clean. Room was more than adequate for Europe, and we had a high floor balcony with a nice view of Paris. As an Elite Marriott member, we had a choice of breakfast or room service every morning, what an incredible touch! Everyone spoke English and bent over backwards to try to help my 10 year old and me. The location only a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe made life in Paris extremely easy! The Metro took you anywhere you would want to go, and the Champs is right there too. I have to give special attention to Xavier the Concierge. He is one of the best I have run into. He gave us tips from Metro purchases, to markets, to times and places for anything we asked. He is incredible at righting backwords, with the map facing you while he explains every detail. I am not trying to brag, but I am at around 1000 stays in 10 years and this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “who needs the ritz?”
Reviews.Author: shirl47
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very contempory and have every facility even a small balcony with table chair and ashtray to accomadate the smoker.most important of all the staff were fantastic,so friendly and obliging.the location is just in veiw of the arc de triomphe in the center of the tourist area,could not be bettered.the breakfast was good especially the coffee and the service .congratulations to the staff for making my 1st visit to paris so wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Style with Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: JLV0909
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel without seeing any pictures as it was brand new when first planned our honeymoon. We got a friends and family rate which made a big difference in the pricing. This hotel is beautiful and classy. It's extremely modern and sleek but comfortable and warm at the same time. We arrived early in the morning and check-in was not supposed to be until 3pm, but they had our room prepared which made all of the difference as we were arriving by an overnight train from Milan. The beds are extremely comfy, the service is outstanding; they literally run into the middle of a street to get a cab for you. All of their recommendations were spot on from restaurants to places to buy the best chocolate. Paris was the last stop on our honeymoon and this hotel made our experience so much better than we had hoped. All of this, plus the location is steps away from the Arc de Triomphe, and the Champs Elysees, which is where all of the great shopping in Paris is. I have 0 complaints about this hotel and I would not stay anywhere else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive locale!”
Reviews.Author: platinumtraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this new hotel in October and was very impressed. The staff was friendly and helpful, even sending me a "welcome email" in advance of my trip to see if they could help with any arrangements. Rooms were spacious (by European standards), clean and made very good use of space. The location was great - in walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysee and the metro line that went straight to the Louvre and Notre Dame. I would definitely stay here again. Only down point (and it's minor) was the restaurant food -- very average and pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Baylane61
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and trendy. It is very close to Champs Elysee and Arc De Triomphe. Major meto station is within walking distance. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room is very clean, modern, and has a small balcony. The food and specially drinks are a little bit too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Spent our 10 yr wedding anniversary here. Very near Arc de Triomphe and very near the Charles de Gaulle Etolle Metro station, a major station with connections on multiple line, ensuring an easy subway route to virtually anywhere in Paris. Also, located within walking distance of a bus stop for the Air France bus, which is a great way to travel to/from CDG airport (www.cars-airfrance.com), which offers service regardless of your airline, less expensive than a taxi, and less stressful than riding the RER/Metro from CDG (our only regret from our honeymoon trip to Paris, 10 years ago -- you WILL regret riding the crowded trains with your luggage!). Regarding specifics about the hotel, frankly we were disappointed with the service. Upon arrival, there was a problem with our room (next to a building or room with loud construction). Front desk insisted that no other rooms were available. Returned to the front desk 30 minutes later, after unbearable nearby noises, and insisted that they either move us to another room or find another hotel for us and -- miracuously -- they had 3 rooms for us to choose from!!! They had lied to me multiple times about no other rooms being available. The rooms are ultra-modern (too modern for our taste) and the thumping music in the lobby made us feel like we were entering a discotheque each time we passed thru the lobby. But the hotel is clean and new. In summary, it is good that this hotel has a GREAT location; were it not for the great location, we would have HATED the hotel; however, due to the location, we reluctantly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TinaConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We spent our 20th wedding anniversary in Paris. The hotel staff went out of their way to make it special. Merci

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scottishbud
Reviews.Content: Great Location beside the Arc de Triomphe. We had a high floor room loocking out over the back of the hotel with a balcony. Great View and quite. Room was lovely and very spacious. Great breakfast. Staff very helpful. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If only Renaissance Hotels in the US were this nice!”
Reviews.Author: ExitRowAisle
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Paris at this property. I used points to book the room and reserved a regular room though was upgraded at check in to a "Business Room" which was larger and had free internet. Additionally, with my status breakfast was included in the restaurant in the morning. The property is about 3 blocks from the Arc De Triomphe near the Champs Elysse. There is plenty to do in that area but it is rather touristy. We were pleasantly greeted in english when we arrived. The property had has a complete remodel and it was great. It was the vibe of a "W" hotel that I think they are going for in Renaissance properties. The front desk staff, bell staff and restaurant staff were all very accomodating and spoke english. We had a great room. The decor is very nice, very masculine. The room was a great size....the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom and it's fixtures and amenities were first rate. The hotel was very stylish, has a great location and a wonderful staff. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on points with my wife and daughter. The hotel is well-situated between 2 Metro stations, one a major one, and all the amenities found in any Paris neighborhood. We ate at several restaurants along Wagram and enjoyed every meal, and shopped for fruits and breads to munch on during our travels in the market about 3 blocks away. The hotel has no DIY washers-dryers, but I was pointed to a "laverie" 2 blocks away. While the reviews on the hotel staff and responsiveness seem to be mixed, I found the staff exceptionally friendly, greeting us by name routinely, offering assistance, and making sound recommendations to our requests and following-up on our satisfaction. As the hotel has no concierge lounge, we were given complimentary breakfast every morning, which is well worth using (at least for free!) My wife and daughter enjoyed a variety of local yoghurts, great breads, eggs cooked-to-order, etc. We didn't eat any meals other than breakfast at the hotel, so I can't comment on that any further. We had a larger queen-bedded room on the rear of the hotel, with an option for a balcony in that location or no balcony but facing Wagram. We took the balcony to enjoy the pleasant Paris weather, and the room was more than large enough to accomodate a very comfy rollaway bed for our 11 year-old. Rooms are large by european standards, very well-designed, with excellent bedding and showers. I'd definately stay here again, but would be put off if paying nearly $500 US vs cashing in some points.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, untolerable smoke smell in "Non-Smoking" rooms!”
Reviews.Author: WrenFlorida
Reviews.Content: We spent a fortune (Way too much!) to book 2 rooms for 2 nights, 7 people in our group. The location was great and we looked forward to staying here since it just opened in May. In the elevators, the decorative lucite panels hanging on the walls were already cracked significantly but the rooms were decorated beautifully...very modern and comfortable. Our biggest complaint was how the hotel handled the overwhelming smoke smell in the room of my sister and her family (including one son with mild asthma). My sister had a room which connected to another (locked door between) and apparently the guests in that room were obsessive smokers. My sister and brother-in-law placed numerous calls to the front desk and they would send up someone to spray Febreeze-- which did no good whatsoever! Even though the hotel is clearly marketed as a Non-Smoking hotel, people were absolutely smoking in the rooms and it appeared to not be an issue to the hotel staff. We even made a couple of visits down to the front desk to speak to a manager about the situation and at one point, we were told their family of 4 could be moved to a tiny room with a full size bed, and they would try and fit 2 cots in for their boys! We were so frustrated at the staff's lack of truly putting in any effort in trying to resolve this issue (anyone can spray air freshener, but it doesn't alleviate the problem!) After dinner when we returned to find the room just as smoky as it had been, we once again went down to speak to a manager (who apparently had left). I reminded the girl how much we were being charged for the rooms and it was completely unacceptable to have part of our party stay in a room where you could barely breathe because of the smell. She placed a phone call and 'miraculously' a suite was available practically across the hall from my room. We're sure they would not have moved them had we not continued to speak up, but we should have never had to complain that much and for that long before something was finally done! Not only was the hotel overpriced (in my opinion, and I travel extensively) but with the weak dollar, it cost us far more that what it should have! Unfortunately we left with a no-so-favorable opinion of the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Modern Amenities, and Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Lexington44
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points for a family vacation, and then paid 70 Euros per night to be upgraded to a larger room with 2 double beds, so all 4 of us could fit in the room. The upgraded room ("Prestige" Room overlooking Wagram Ave. and Arc de Triomphe) also included Internet access and a "pod" espresso maker with espresso and tea. Before we even arrived, the hotel emailed me to ask when we would be arriving (we flew on an overnight flight that arrived early in the morning) so they could try to have the room ready early for us. When we arrived, our room was ready at 11:00AM, which was a great benefit so we could take a short nap and recover from the overnight, sleepless flight. The room was large and very comfortable. The beds were great, the AC was strong, and the shower was excellent. It definitely felt like staying in a new, modern hotel. We even came back to our room that evening to find wine, candy, and a Paris guide book with a letter thanking us for choosing their new hotel. Very nice touch. The location was fantastic. We ate at many restaurants on Wagram Ave., and there was a wide range of choices and prices. We did not have one bad meal, and most were excellent. As has been mentioned, it is a very short walk to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysee, and a major Metro station (CDG Etoile) with several lines and even the RER train to Paris Disney, which allowed to go back and forth easily in one day. The other direction from the hotel has an even closer Metro station (Ternes), but we only used it once to go to Montmartre/Sacre Coeur. Even though the hotel is on the western side of Paris, the location was a major advantage in that wherever we were, we could almost always find a very close Metro station that would get us back to the hotel without having to change lines. That was a big relief for the kids at the end of a long day of walking. We had a fabulous trip and the hotel was a major part of our enjoyment. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, spacious room in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: christyv20
Reviews.Content: Our room was perfect. The king size bed was uber comfortable. We had all the amenities of an American hotel & more! The staff was friendly & helpful. The recommendations that we were given for a nice restaurant (Le Grande Cascade, i think?) were superb. Very classy & the food was excellent! The hotel was also close to a major metro station (line 1). We would definitely stay here again when returning to Paris. The hotel is still very new & was in excellent condition & very clean. It pays very close attn to detail & we were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location...!”
Reviews.Author: Steven5218
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent. Metro is just up the street. We were upgraded to a higher room on arrival. Complimentary champagne and gifts for our anniversary. The staff were very nice and courteous although they didn't fall over us like other reviews have suggested. The hotel is brand new and although the main entrance and lobby are nothing special, the rooms are nice and clean - very well thought out. The lighting was very well planned and we had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Might be a bit on the expensive side, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent staff ! !”
Reviews.Author: LovetheMarriott
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel in June for 3 days and let me tell you we were blown away by the service. We were checked in by a lovely female receptionist called Sophie. She was extremely polite, extremely proffesional and welcomed us with a great big smile close to midnight. The hotel is located 2 min walk from Arc De Triomphe and Charles De Gaulle Etoile station. It takes 10 mins on the train to get to Eiffel Tower so location wise this hotel was so so convenient. Concierge staff were also really helpful and helped us always with maps and recommending good restaurants. They even planned a whole day for us. Rooms are very decent sized for a European hotel and bathroom was quite nice too. The only thing that lacked was as swimming pool otherwise this hotel gets 5/5 from me. Great staff, great location, great hotel ! !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: calif-native54
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days in Paris at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. The service was perfect. Chloe (baggage porter) was so friendly and even ran down the block to grab us a cab so we wouldn't have to wait. Our doorman, a young Czech man, was so helpful and happy, running to the door to open it for us. The room was huge and the rollaway (for our teenager) was set up upon arrival. Free wi-fi and an hour late check out with no charge. The restaurant looked nice but my husband insisted upon eating at cafes. Sorry no reccomendations from what we found. But my teenager loved the Pizza Hut down the street (buy one get one free) and the McDonalds a few doors down. The Hop on Hop off bus service was great. Print your tickets online, walk around the Arc on Tislit circle and grab the bus at the Lido stop. We bought 3 day tickets with a boat trip and ran all around the city. After touring, we switched bus routes and hopped different busses to get to our destinations without going through the whole tour. Only needed a taxi to get to La Gar de Nord for our Eurostar to London.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 39 Avenue de Wagram, 75017 Paris, France
